loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as disciplined. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en: Irimiya is a 55-year-old farmer from Gedege.  As a Babban Gona member, Irimiya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Irimiya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Irimiya is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Irimiya is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Patience,  and  Rufai. Irimiya’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Bayardo De Jesús

texts.es: La agricultura es una de las principales actividades de comercio y de sobrevivencia de todos los nicaragüenses así como de Don Bayardo que a sus cortos 16 años de edad comenzó a dedicarse a la siembra de granos (maíz, frijoles, trigo) con su mamá. Ahora hace más de 25 años se dedica a la siembra de musáceas popularmente conocido como plátanos. En la actualidad posee unas 18 hectáreas de siembra de dicho cultivo y desea seguir creciendo más es por tal motivo que requiere de un préstamo para el pago de la limpieza de las 18 hectáreas. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le ayudara a continuar en la actividad de siembra de musáceas. Sus principales metas son la adquisición de un sistema de riego ya que de esta manera lograra que su cultivo se mantenga en pie y obtenga una excelente producción. Sus planes futuros son el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Agriculture is one of the main commercial activities and means of surviving for all Nicaraguans.  Bayrdo, at a young age of 16, started to grow basic crops (corn, beans, wheat) with his mother.  Now, at age 25, he grows musaceae, popularly known as bananas.

He currently has 18 hectares planted with this crop.  He wishes to continue growing more.  That is why he needs a loan to pay for the clearing of the 18 hectares.  He feels that the requested loan will help him to continue with the business activity of growing bananas.

His main goal is to get a watering system.  This way he will manage to keep his crop thriving, and he will get an excellent production.  His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: to pay for the clearing of his 18 hectares.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a Babban Gona farmer. Felix is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is this ambition that led Felix to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Felix can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Felix, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access required yield enhancing inputs, such as improved seeds. Felix is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. With this loan, Felix will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a Babban Gona farmer. Peter is driven by one goal; to “make more money for myself and my family.” It is this ambition that led Peter to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Peter can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Peter, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access required yield enhancing inputs, such as improved seeds. Peter is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. With this loan, Peter will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо с детства всегда мечтала стать бизнес леди зарабатывать много денег. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Дилрабо данное время нуждается организовать свой бизнес, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправляет ежемесячно достаточно денег для их проживания. Дилрабо планирует начать бизнес скотоводством, то есть она будет покупать бараны, откармливать несколько месяцев и продавать мясникам. С бизнесом она будет справляться сама. Дилрабо участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она написала свой бизнес план. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 550 сомони для покупки барана. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilrabo is 26, married, and raising 2 children.  Ever since she was a child, she has dreamed of one day becoming a businesswoman and earning a lot of money; she thinks now is the right time to start her own business in particular as her husband, a migrant worker in Russia, hasn't been sending enough money home to support their family.  Dilrabo is planning on raising sheep, i.e. by fattening and reselling them to butcher's shops, and will be managing the business all on her own.  To help develop her entrepreneurial skills, she enrolled in a course titled "Achieve Success" organized by an association for businesswomen and received a certificate upon completion.  She's written a plan of business, and is seeking a loan of 550 somoni to buy a sheep to start with.  She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy a sheep to set up a new business

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He finds his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. He hopes that in the future he will have stability. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира решила организовать свой бизнес, и ее муж поддерживает ее в этом. Нодира воспитывает 2 детей. Она все эти годы была домохозяйкой, и теперь она хочет организовать свой бизнес. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес скотоводством. Нодира с такой целью участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 550 сомони для покупки скота. Ее муж будет помогать ей введению бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nodira has decided to start a new business and her husband supports this decision.  She is raising two children and has been a housewife for all these years, but now she wants to start a new business.  She plans to start raising livestock and with that goal in mind, she enrolled in the "Get Ahead" course organized by the Association of Businesswomen and received a certificate.  Nodira is asking for a loan of 550 somoni so she can buy cattle.  Her husband will help her run this business.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en: Cosmas is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a chemist business where he sells medicine. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy and populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of medicine. He hopes that in the future, he will have a quality life.

loans.use: buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Ahmed is a member of this group from Iraq. He is 24 years old and married and has one child. His family depends on his income for their living. Ahmed opened a grocery shop eight years ago and gradually managed to increase the amount of goods he sells and attract more customers.

He is requesting this youth loan to purchase more goods, to be able to develop his business and meet his customers' needs. This will increase his income and improve his family's financial situation.

The story of Ahmed and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development's clients.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in his grocery shop.

loans.name: Fenias

texts.pt:
VIVE MARITALMENTE, TEM 2 FILHOS MENORES , TEM 34 ANOS DE IDADE, TEM NIVEL MEDIO, TRABALHA COMO POLICIA E  TAMBEM TEM NEGOCIO O QUAL É GERIDO PELA SUA ESPOSA. VIVE NA CASA PROPRIA E ESTA A REPETIR O CREDITO PELA 4ª VEZ.
COM O CRÉDITO PRETENDE COMPRAR BEBIDAS, FARINHA, OLEO, MENTEIGA, YOUGURTS, OMO, FRANGOS, CARNES, ETC, PARA AMPLIAR O SEU NEGOCIO QUE FAZ POR ENCOMENDAS E ENTREGA NAS LOJAS DE MOAMBA E MAPUTO.
ELE TEM O SONHO DE PODER CRESCER NO NEGOCIO, MELHORAR O SEU NIVEL ACADEMICO E PROFISSIONAL E BEM COMO DAR CONTINUIDADE À CONSTRUÇÃO DE SUA CASA.
O SEU MAIOR DESAFIO É A CONCORRENCIA NO NEGOCIO
texts.en:
Fenias lives with his wife and 2 children who are both minors, he is 34 years old and has finished high school. He works as a policeman and also has a business which is run by his wife. He lives in a house he owns and this is his fourth loan.

With this loan he plans to buy drinks, flour, oil, butter, yoghurts, OMO washing powder, chickens, meats, etc to expand his business. His customers place orders with him which he then delivers to shops in Moamba and Maputo.

His dream is to be able to grow his business, improve his level of education and professional standing and also to continue the building work on his house.

His biggest challenge is the competition he faces with his business.

loans.use: buy drinks, flour, oil, butter, yoghurts, OMO washing powder, chickens, meats, etc to expand his business

loans.name: Jhon

texts.pt:
O Sr. Jhon  de 69 anos de idade, casado e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 3 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario 1 sem  idade para frequentar a escola e os 2 são maiores de idade e são independente. Ele è operador de maquina na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 6 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, barrotes, janelas e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Jhon is 69 years old, married and the father of 6 children of whom 3 attend school, 1 is too young to do so and 2 are already of age and independent. He has been a machine operator at the banana production company for more than 6 years.

With this loan he will buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, windows) and pay for labour to continue the building work on his home.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, windows) and pay for labour to continue the building work on his home.

loans.name: Henriques

texts.pt:
O Sr. Henriques  de 27 anos de idade, casada e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estão a frequentar  a escola no ensino primario e 1 sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è empacotadora de banana na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 4 anos 
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, cimento, varrões  e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Henriques is 27 years old, married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom are in primary school and 1 who is still too young to go to school. He has been a packer at the banana production company for more than 4 years.

With this loan he will buy construction materials (bricks, cement, rods) and pay for labour to continue the building work on his home.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, rods) and pay for labour to continue the building work on his home.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's Group is comprised of 3 hard-working women. Christine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet for making the brew, and it will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to build a bigger bar. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more millet for making brew to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат родилась в 1970 году. Она добрая и справедливая женщина. Инобат вместе со своей семьей живет в Таджикистане. Она замужем и мать 2 детей. Инобат основная кормилица своих детей, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Инобат занимается скотоводством и земледелием. Она работает упорно, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Инобат вместе с детьми живет в старой квартире, и она срочно должна сделать ремонт. Инобат запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Inobat was born in 1970.  She is a kind and fair woman and she lives with her family in Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of two children.  Inobat is the main breadwinner in her family, as her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  She raises livestock and grows crops and she works hard to support her family.  Inobat lives with her children in an old flat, which is desperately in need of repairs.  She is asking for a loan of 1,500 somoni to buy building materials like paint, wallpaper, etc.  She is awaiting your kindness and counting on your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her flat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chicks, ration and vaccines to expand her business raising chickens

loans.name: Mercia

texts.pt:
MÃE SOLTEIRA DE 2 FILHOS MENORES DE IDADE, 1 COM IDADE ESCOLAR E A ESTUDAR, VIVE NA CASA PRÓPRIA, TEM 34 ANOS DE IDADE, ESTUDOU ATE 6ª CLASSE, FAZ NEGOCIO DE VENDA DE DIVERSOS OLEOS DE MOTORES E ALGUNS ACESSORIOS DE AUTOMOVEIS COM UMA LONGA EXPERIENCIA E VENDE TODOS DIAS, ESTA A REPETIR O CREDITO PELA 2ª VEZ.
PRETENDE COMPRAR OLEOS E ACESSORIOS DE AUTOMOVEIS PARA AMPLIAR O SEU NEGOCIO.
ELA TEM O SONHO DE PODER AMPLIAR MAIS O SEU NEGOCIO, CONCLUIR A CONSTRUÇÃO DE SUA CASA E MOBILAR DE MANEIRAS A NÃO PRECISAR MAIS DE AVAL DE TEREIROS NOS PROXIMOS CREDITOS.
O SEU MAIOR DESAFIO É A CONCORRENCIA NO NEGOCIO, DE TAL MANEIRA QUE AS VEZES FICA SEM VENDER MAS QUE MESMO ASSIM VALE A PENA O SEU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Mercia is a single mother of 2 children who are still minors, 1 of whom is of school-going age and the other is still too young to study. She lives in a house she owns, is 34 years old and completed her studies until the 6th grade. She has a business selling various types of engine oils and some car accessories. She has a lot of experience and works every day. This is her 2nd loan.

She plans to buy engine oils and car accessories to expand her business.

Her dream is to be able to expand her business, to finish building her home and to furnish it so that for future loans she won't need guarantees from third parties.

Her biggest challenge is the competition as on some days she doesn't sell anything - but even so, her business is worth it.

loans.use: buy engine oils and car accessories to expand her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A Sra. Maria de 43 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 4 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e os 2 sao maior de idade e são independentes. Ela è operaria agricola na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 5 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, barrotes, janelas e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is 43 years old, single and the mother of 6 children, of whom 4 got to school (primary and secondary school) and 2 are of age and independent. She has been a farmer for the banana production company for over 5 years.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, windows) and to pay for the labour to continue the construction of her house.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, windows) and to pay for the labour to continue the construction of her house.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Emelina de 34 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario. Ela è empacotadora de banana na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 3 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, barrotes, area, varroes  e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emelina is 34 years old, single and the mother of 2 children who go to primary and secondary school. She has been a packer at the local banana production company for more than 3 years.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, sand, rods) and to pay for the labour to continue the construction of her house.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, beams, sand, rods) and to pay for the labour to continue the construction of her house.

loans.name: Vanney

texts.en: Vanney is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells basins, vacuum flasks, plates, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She finds that her biggest business challenge is a financial one. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, plates, and other items. She hopes that in the future she will have a quality life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her bills.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, plates, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air compressor and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Lucia de 69 anos de idade casa e mae de 4 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario, sustenta  sua mae e sua irma. Ela è negociante informal de vestuario  a mais de 20 anos, actividade que esta a explorar junto com seus filhos, sua mercadoria vende a porta da sua casa e por encomenda.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar  material de construcao (blocos, portas, cimento e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para reabilitar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia is 69 years old and the mother of 4 children who go to primary and secondary school. She also supports her mother and her sister.
She has been selling clothing for more than 20 years, a business she is carrying out with her children. She sells her products door-to-door and through customer orders.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, doors) and to pay for the labour to fix her house.

loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, doors) and to pay for the labour to fix her house.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 52-year-old  hardworking woman, married to Peter, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with three children.  Magdalena has been a farmer for five years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbour and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 and intends to use this amount to buy more farm inputs, seedlings, and fertilizers for her farm plantation.

Magdalena plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: To  buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Magona Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her mid 30's, is single with one daughter who is still at school.  Salma has been selling fried fish for two years now.  She works from 5 AM to 10 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Salma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy a stock of fish, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking.  She dreams of owning a butcher shop.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group, Magona,  which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fish, cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Harold De Jesus

texts.es: Harold de 19 años, desde el año 2012, después de haber trabajado en un municipio del departamento del Magdalena, en el procesamiento de frutas deshidratadas, decidió por su propia cuenta emprender este mismo negocio. Hoy produce frutas deshidratadas, que comercializa a vendedores independientes, y revistas acreditandoselos. El proceso lo realiza mediante los siguientes pasos: descontaminación de frutas, elaboración, deshidratación y empaque, trabajando todos los dias, desde las 2 de la tarde a 9 de la noche. Su meta mas importante es ingresar al mercado de almacenes de cadena y su mayor desafío es lograr todos los registros del proceso. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Etiquetas, empaques, frutas y hará adecuación de maquinaria. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, pues incrementará su productividad y generará habilidad para responder los pedidos a crédito de su clientela
texts.en:
Harold is 19 years old.  In 2012, after having worked in a municipality in the Magdalena department processing dehydrated fruit, he decided to undertake his own business doing this.  He now produces dehydrated fruits that he sells to independent sellers and to designated catalogs.

He engages in the process through the following steps:  decontamination of the fruit, processing, dehydrating, and packing.  He works every day from two in the afternoon until nine at night.

His most important goal is to enter the chain store market.  His greatest challenge is managing all of the records of the process.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy labels, packaging, and fruit, and he will adjust his machinery.  With this investment his business will improve.  He will increase his productivity and generate the ability to respond to his customers’ orders on credit.

loans.use: to buy labels, packaging, and fruit, and he to adjust his machinery.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her bills.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: No Jesus No Life Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two people who live in the same district. They are into hair products and second hand clothing. 

The group's representative, Vida, is 53 years old. She left school at the primary level. She is married to Silas and has one child. She lives with her husband and child. 

Vida has been selling second hand clothing from door to door for over 10 years. This enables her to meet her needs without too much difficulty. In order to be able to better respond to her customers' needs, Vida would like to strengthen her business and is requesting, together with the other member of the No Jesus group, a fifth loan from ID-Ghana. The previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: To buy one bale of second hand clothing for sell.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena de 26 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo, tiene 15 años de experiencia en el cuidado de animales y crianza de pollos de engorde, estudio hasta el tercer año de bachillerato.


Lorena aprendió el oficio de la ganadería hace 15 años,  con sus padres y decidió dedicarse a ello ya que no podía encontrar un empleo formal y actualmente esta en su fuente de ingresos.


Lorena solicita un préstamo en CREDICAMPO,  para comprar 2 novillas de repasto,  concentrado y vitaminas para pollos de engorde los cuales criá de forma artesanal.


Lorena planea trabajar muy duro y ahorrar para poder mejorar su casa y que sus hijos tengan una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Lorena, age 26, is married and has a son.  She has 15 years of experience taking care of animals and raising and fattening chickens.  She went to school through the third year of high school.  

Lorena learned the livestock trade 15 years ago.  She learned with her parents, and she decided to devote herself to this trade because she could not find formal employment.  This is currently her source of income.

Lorena is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy two grazing calves, concentrated feed, and vitamins for the chickens she fattens.  She takes care of them herself.

Lorena plans to work very hard and to save in order to be able to improve her house so that her children have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy two grazing calves, concentrated feed, and vitamins for the chickens she fattens.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is married and has 7 children. She describes herself to be determined. For the past 15 years, Monica has operated a retail business selling onions. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. Monica will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of onions. Her business goal is to own a lorry for transportation within 5 years. Monica hopes that, in the future, she will build  a permanent house. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married and has 6 children. She describes herself to be focused. For the past 12 years, Alice has operated a retail business selling fish, tomatoes and bananas. Her business is located in a market area. Alice describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits, fish and other vegetables. Her business goal is to start another business within 5 years. Alice hopes that, in the future, she will have improved life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, fish and other vegetables

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Saumu has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her major business challenge is creditors who take a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. Saumu will use the requested loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Marina Gladys

texts.es:
Marina de 57 años de edad, estudió hasta 6 grado y vive sola, procreo  6 hijos y todos viven de forma independiente con sus conyuges, aunque siempre le ayudan.


Marina , tiene 18 años de de experiencia en la siembra de maíz, pero también vende pupusas, tamales, refrescos y ropa, también es muy colaboradora en los proyectos de desarrollo de su comunidad; por lo que es muy apreciada por las personas.


Marina  un préstamo en CREDICAMPO , para comprar fertilizantes y semilla para sembrar7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, así podrá obtener un ingreso extra y almacenar su cosecha para su alimentación.


Marina sueña con mejorar su vivienda, para vivir en una condición mas cómoda.
texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old, studied through 6th grade, and lives alone. She has 6 children, all of whom live independently with their spouses although they always help her.

Marina has 18 years of experience sowing corn, but she also sells stuffed tortillas, tamales, refreshments, and clothing. She also helps very much with development projects in her community. For this reason, people really appreciate her.

Martina has requested a loan from CrediCampo to buy fertilizers and seeds to sow 7,000 square meters of corn. That way, she will be able to obtain extra earnings and to store her crops for use as food for herself. Marina dreams of improving her house in order to live in more comfortable conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to sow 7,000 square meters of corn. That way, she will be able to obtain extra earnings and to store her crops for use as food for herself.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (bricks, cement, rods) and to pay for the labour to continue building his house.

loans.name: Phelix

texts.en: Phelix is a married man. He describes himself to be obedient. For the past 10 years, Phelix has operated a carpentry business making furniture. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and to buy building materials to construct a house for his family

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is married and he has 3 children. He describes himself to be patient. For the past 5 years, George has operated a retail business selling hair chemicals and clothes. His business is located in a nice place and his primary customers are women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. George will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of hair chemicals and clothes. His business goal is to have more stock within 5 years. George hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hair chemicals and clothes

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is married and she has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. Loice operates a retail business selling sugar, bread and other items. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. Loice will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread and other items. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build an annex he will use as a kitchen.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Hello! Meet James, a very hardworking, energetic and honest man who is 44 years of age. He lives in the rich highlands of Nyamira with his wife and 5 children. James has been practicing farming for the past 15 years and, through those years, he has been able to support his family. His primary sources of income are egg, tea, and crop farming. The Kisii area is populated and has a ready market for poultry products. However, James' biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry. Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large scale farmer to benefit from it. 

Through the loan, James will be able to sell eggs, meat and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in his area.

James has been facing challenges accessing finances but he feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. James chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low and is on a reducing basis. James underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, James' income will increase and his life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for his family and a positive impact to the community.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Samtredia district. Tamar works at local kindergarten and gets a small monthly income. Her husband works at a railway station. Tamar wants to start new stable business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1000 to begin a trading business. She will get orders and will purchase cars by internet from Japan and will sell them in Samtredia district. She will be able to have additional income and will be able to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to begin trading cars from Japan.

loans.name: Gustavo Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo de 24 años de edad, se graduó como bachiller, esta casado y tiene una hija de un año de edad, su esposa se dedica solo a los oficios de la casa, pero esta buscando empleo en una tienda de el pueblo.

Alfredo tiene un año de estar trabajando para una empresa que da mantenimiento a las lineas telefónicas, para hacer su trabajo se tiene que desplazar a varias ciudades durante todo el día y aveces todo el fin de semana.


Alfredo solicita un préstamo a CREDICAMPO,  para comprar materiales de construcción, como arena, cemento, grava, para mejorar una habitación donde vive con su esposa y su hija la cual esta en la propiedad de su suegro.

Alfredo sueña con tener su casa propia, para ello esta trabajando muy duro y ahorrando aunque sea por poquitos.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 24 years old and a high school graduate. He is married and has a one-year-old daughter. His wife currently only takes care of household chores, but she is looking for a job at a store in town.  

For the past year, Alfredo has been working for a company that provides maintenance to telephone lines. To do his job, he has to travel to various cities throughout the day and sometimes throughout the entire weekend.

Alfredo is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and gravel to improve the house where he lives with his wife and daughter, which is located on his father-in-law's property. 

Alfredo dreams of having his own home. For this reason, he is working very hard and saving little by little.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and gravel to improve the house where he lives with his wife and daughter, which is located on his father-in-law's property.

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en:
The loan group “God Will Provide” is made up of two ladies who are into fish and banku (cooked corn dough and cassava dough). They have been active for several years and have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

Gladys, the group’s representative, is active in selling banku and fish, with over 37 years of experience. The loan will be used to purchase maize and fish to prepare banku and fish to sell to customers. Gladys will use the profits from the sales to support her husband in covering household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize and fish to prepare banku and fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mauro Adan

texts.es:
Mauro de 19 años de edad, es bachiller y esta soltero, vive con sus padres hace un año egreso como bachiller general, pero por falta de dinero no continuo sus estudios universitarios.


Mauro tiene 10 años de experiencia en trabajos de agricultura, ya que desde niño siempre ha trabajado sembrando maíz y cuidando los animales, esto lo aprendió con su papá, sus cultivos los tiene en la comunidad donde vive.


Mauro solicita un préstamo en CREDICAMPO, para comprar fertilizantes y semilla para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz de donde espera obtener alguna ganancia y almacenar un poco de maíz para su alimentación.


Mauro sueña con ir a la universidad y graduarse como ingeniero agronomo para ello piensa trabajar y poder costear sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mauro is 19 years old. He is a high school graduate and single. He lives with his parents and graduated a year ago, but due to a lack of money, didn't go on to college.   

Mauro has 10 years' experience in agricultural work, since he has worked planting corn and caring for animals since he was a child. He learned from his father and his crops are in the community where he lives. 

Mauro is asking for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant 7,000 square meters of corn that he hopes to profit from, and to store a little corn for food.  

Mauro dreams of going to college and graduate as an agronomics engineer. To do that, he plans on working and being able to pay for his education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant 7,000 square meters of corn that he hopes to profit from, and to store a little corn for food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her stock of water and sell to more people.

loans.name: Francela Javiera

texts.es:
Francela tiene metas definidas desde pequeña, por lo que a diario se esfuerza para salir adelante. Siempre ha querido estudiar Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas, trabajar y dirigir su propio negocio. A sus 20 años, está cumpliendo una de sus metas estudiando el tercer año de la carrera que siempre ha soñado. 
Francela vive con sus padres, quienes le otorgan el apoyo moral y económico todo el tiempo. El papá trabaja en remodelación de casas y la mamá vende gaseosas y cosméticos desde el hogar. Ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, está enfocada en sus estudios, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar un computadora, ya que la necesita para realizar los trabajaos en línea que le asignan en la universidad, así podrá entregarlos a tiempo y obtener buenos resultados académicos. Entre sus planes está terminar sus estudios universitarios, conseguir un trabajo y estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Francela has had defined goals since she was young, so she makes an effort every day to get ahead.  She has always wanted to study Business Administration, work, and manage her own business.  At 20 years old, she is achieving one of her goals since she is in her third year of school for the career she has always dreamed of.

Francela lives with her parents, who give her moral and financial support all of the time.  Her father works remodeling homes and her mother sells sodas and cosmetics from their home.  She is single and has no children.  She is focused on her studies, so she is requesting a loan to purchase a computer, since she needs it to do online work assigned by the university.  She can do the work on time and get good grades.  

She plans to finish her university studies, get a job, and study for a masters degree.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en:
Gavhar, who was born in 1965, is a careful mother of 5 children, three of them adults. Gavhar’s husband is a migrant in the Russian Federation. Gavhar has been busy growing and selling agricultural products such as carrots and crops for more than 10 years. She grows her products in 0.30 ha of rented land. Gavhar also feeds cows. Her children help her to manage the business. She always tries for her family's well-being. 

Gavhar is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit, which she will use to improve the family's living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 28 years old, is married and has two children. His family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) and they live in an IDP settlement. Ibrahim's wife is a housekeeper. Ibrahim raises vegetables (greens, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc.) and fruit trees (apples, pears, etc.). He has 10 years of experience in this field. His monthly income is 150 AZN and he gets an additional small income working as a driver.

People living in IDP settlements have higher demands for such products as fresh fruits and vegetables. They prepare juice, fruit pies, etc. and make different kinds of salads. 

Ibrahim needs to improve the conditions of his garden. He has applied for a loan of 800 AZN to buy garden tools and repair his garden. He wants to get more money in order to improve his family's hard life.

loans.use: to buy garden tools and repair his garden

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is 49 years old. She lives with her pensioner mother in the Kvareli district, Kakheti region of East Georgia. Maia is unemployed at the moment. She wants to open a hostel and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1,600. Maia will use the loan to renovate rooms in her house and to open a hostel. She will have a stable income and improve her family's living conditions. Maia awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate rooms and open a hostel

loans.name: Pedro Celestino

texts.es:
Pedro de 47 años de edad,  por motivos que no había escuela en su lugar cuando él creció, no estudio y desde pequeño se dedicó al trabajo de la agricultura y también al de la acuicultura en estanques.

Él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos tienen 3 hijos y viven con ellos en su casa, 2 le ayudan al trabajo de la agricultura y 1 está estudiando, y los 3 son los que dependen de él, 

Pedro tiene 35 años de experiencia de dedicarse a este trabajo y lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que se lo enseñaron desde pequeño,  él sabe que esta es una actividad que realiza año con año y  sea dado cuenta que haciendo su milpa él se ahorra bastante en la alimentación que le proporciona a su familia, aparte de esto también se dedica a la acuicultura ya que atreves de esto él obtiene ingresos cuando vende el pescado,  él este trabajo lo realiza de 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para cultivar su milpa de postrera, ya que con esto pretende darle un buen manejo a su milpa para poder obtener un mayor rendimiento de cosecha, así con esto el tendrá para suplir el gasto de su familia, y además de lo que le sobra lo podrá vender.
texts.en:
Pedro is 47 years old.  He did not attend school because there was no school where he grew up, and since he was young, he has worked as a farmer and at aquaculture in ponds.

He is married and his wife does domestic work.  They have three children and live with them in their home.  Two help with farming and one is attending school.  All three depend on him.

Pedro has 35 years of experience doing this work, and he learned from his parents, who taught him when he was young.  He knows that this is work that is done year after year.  He realized that planting corn allowed him to save a lot on the food he provides to his family.  He also works in aquaculture and earns income when he sells his fish.  He works from 6:00am until 12:00pm.  

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to grow his corn crop.  This will allow him to manage his corn well so that he can have a good harvest.  He will be able to supply the needs of his family and he will sell anything extra.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Oscar Erick

texts.es:
Oscar de 31 años de edad, es licenciado en idioma inglés, está casado y su esposa tiene la misma profesión que él, ambos trabajan en una institución de educación de idiomas como docentes impartiendo clases de inglés y en una universidad privada del país, viven solos ya que aún no tienen hijos, apenas esperan el primero.

 Él tiene cinco años de trabajar como maestro de inglés, viaja en autobús, se tarda aproximadamente 20 minutos para llegar a su empleo desde su casa en el autobús.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagarle a un usurero que le presto para pagar una deuda que obtuvo de forma indirecta dando una firma solidaria  a un pariente y para que su record no se dañara tuvo que cancelar.

Oscar se siente muy feliz por haber alcanzado sus metas en el estudio, y se sentirá mejor cuando termine de construir su casa y ver a sus hijos ya grandes porque piensa tener más a parte del que esperan, y verlos como todos profesionales igual que él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Oscar is 31 years old. He holds a bachelor’s degree in English. He is married, and his wife has the same profession as him. Both work as English teachers for a language school and a private university in their country. They live alone because they don’t have children yet. They are currently expecting their firstborn.

He has been working as an English teacher for five years. He travels by bus. It takes him approximately 20 minutes to get from his home to his work by bus.

He is requesting a loan to CREDICAMPO to pay a usurer who lent him money to pay off a debt that he had contracted indirectly by co-signing for a relative—he had to pay off the debt so that his credit record would not be affected.

Oscar is very happy for having achieved his study goals, and he will feel better when he finishes building his house and sees his children grow up and become professionals just like him and his wife—he plans on having more children besides the one they are expecting.

loans.use: to pay a usurer who lent him money to pay off a debt that he had contracted indirectly by co-signing for a relative. He had to pay off the debt so that his credit record would not be affected.

loans.name: Dairo

texts.es: Dairo de 29 años de edad,  tiene una familia conformada por su cónyuge y dos hijos menores. Para sostener su familia tiene un pequeño negocio desde el año 2012, mediante el cual vende frutas y verduras. Su negocio inició porque en su condición de miembro de familia desplazada, debió llegar al municipio donde hoy habita y buscar la forma de ganar dinero para que su familia subsistiera. Empezó vendiendo calle por calle en una carretilla y le agregó la venta de frito para que la realizara su cónyuge; gradualmente a su negocio de frutería agregó una infraestructura mas adecuada como hasta la fecha la tiene y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Dairo vende los productos de acuerdo a la cosecha diariamente, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su meta mas adelante, es tener su propio local y proveerle una educación de calidad a sus hijos, para que lleguen a ser profesionales . Su mayor desafió para el cumplimiento de sus propósitos, es el capital de trabajo, pues no es suficiente para el alcance de sus sueños. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará verduras, frutas, carnes de res, aves, porcina y huevos de gallina, con ello se incrementarán sus inventarios pues tendrá una mayor variedad en sus productos, mejorando así su negocio generados de ingresos.
texts.en:
Dairo is 29 years old and has a family composed of his spouse and two young children. To support his family he has had a small business since 2012 where he sells fruit and vegetables. He started his business as they were a displaced family who arrived in the municipality where they now live and he had to find a way to sustain his family. He started selling from street to street with a small cart and added the sale of fried foods which his spouse made. Gradually his fruit business adapted to a more adequate infrastructure and up to now has been growing little by little.

Dario sells the products depending on what is being harvested, each day from 6 am until 9 at night. His goal for the future is to have his own sales location and provide quality education for his children so that they can become professionals.

His main challenge to achieving his goals is working capital. His is not sufficient to meet his dreams. This is the reason he is requesting a loan from Kiva, the first loan he has had through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy vegetables, fruit, beef, chicken, pork and eggs. With it he will increase his inventory and have a greater variety in his products, improving the generation of income for his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, beef, chicken, pork and eggs.

loans.name: Zoila Patricia

texts.es: Zoila, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes. Su actividad de generación de ingresos es la venta de ropa y perfumes, este negocio lo tiene hace 4 años y 7 meses en su casa. Los productos que ofrece son: ropa, sombrillas y  perfumes. El préstamo es el segundo ciclo y es de 13,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá, en la compra de mercadería de sombrillas, ropa y perfumes para surtir el negocio y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Zoila, who is 27 years old, is married and has two children  She lives with her husband and children in a neighborhood in the city of Puerto Cortes.  Her work to generate income is selling clothes and perfumes from her home, which she has been doing for 4 years and 7 months.  The products she offers for sale are clothing, umbrellas and perfumes.    This is Zoila's second loan, and is for 13,000 lempiras.  She will invest this money in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business with: umbrellas, clothing and perfume.  Her goal is to make her business grow and help her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as umbrellas,clothes and perfume to stock her business

loans.name: Sonia Marleny

texts.es:
Sonia de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 6°grado de educación básica, ella por motivos de escasos recursos económicos ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios.
 Ella es acompañada su esposo se dedica al trabajo de transporte colectivo de pasajeros, ellos tienen 2 hijos una hija que está estudiando 4|° grado y un hijo que viajo para el extranjero hace 3 años.

Sonia se dedica al trabajo de cuido de animales domésticos y también a atender una tienda que posee, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio, y lo emprendió ya que es una forma de la cual ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos sin descuidar los oficios de su casa.  Antes de dedicarse a este negocio, desempeñaba el trabajo de la agricultura junto con su esposo.

Sonia atiende su negocio durante todo el día, también en este se involucra su hija después que llega de estudiar. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, fósforos, gas propano, embutidos, bebidas, galletas, pan, golosinas, etc. Para vender en su tienda, ya que tiene gran demanda de estos productos debido a que es la única tienda que se encuentra en ese lugar, y ella necesita comprar mercadería suficiente para suplir la demanda de su mercado en su comunidad,  para darles un mejor servicio a sus cliente.

Ella a futuro desea  tener un buen negocio, fuerte que le permita a futuro tener mayores ingresos, y a la misma vez satisfacer las necesidades de sus cliente, con los productos que les ofrece, ya que con esto ella pretende a futuro, tener ingresos que le permita poder darle apoyo económico a su hija en su estudio, para que pueda realizar su sueño y pueda ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old and studied up to Grade 6. For economic reasons she could not continue her studies. She is married and her husband works on public transport buses. She has two children, a daughter who is in Grade 4 and a son who went abroad 3 years ago.

Sonia works caring for domestic animals and also has had a store for 8 years. She started it as it is a way she could make money not neglecting her household work. Before she had this business she worked in agriculture with her husband. Sonia cares for her store during the day and her daughter helps her when she is finished with her studies.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, matches, propane gas, sausages, soft drinks, biscuits, bread, sweets, etc. to sell in her store. She has a lot of demand for these products as it is the only store in her neighborhood and she needs to buy enough merchandise to cover the demand in her community and to provide better service to her clients.

She hopes to have a good business in the future which would allow her more income and at the same time satisfy the needs of the customers with the products she offers. She wants for the future to necessary income to support her daughter in her studies so she can realize her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, matches, propane gas, sausages, soft drinks, biscuits, bread, sweets, etc for her store.

loans.name: Ligia Maritza

texts.es:
Doña Ligia con mucho empeño y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante, antes tenía un pequeño salón de belleza pero su papa hace cinco años le dejo como herencia una pequeña pulpería. Con 46 años, está en unión libre y tiene dos hijos pero solo uno tiene a su cargo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero, su mama y sus hijos. 

Requiere el préstamo para surtir su pulpería comprar granos básicos, productos de aseo personal, productos de limpieza de la casa entre otros. Su meta próxima es hacer más grande el negocio y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Dentro de sus plan futuro esta establecer un pequeño bar cerca de su casa. Sin duda alguna doña Ligia es una mujer con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ligia through much effort and dedication has managed to get ahead. She had a small beauty salon before but five years ago her father left her a small store as an inheritance. At 46 years of age she is in a common-law relationship and has two children, only one of whom is dependent on her. She has the support of her spouse, her mother and her children.

She needs a loan to stock her store, buying basic grains, personal cleaning products, household cleaning products, amongst others. Her next goal is to expand her business and improve the infrastructure of her house. Amongst her plans is to open a small bar close to her house. Without doubt Ligia is a woman with much desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, personal cleaning products, household cleaning products, amongst others.

loans.name: Lesbia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lesbia es una señora que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Madre de 2 hijos ya independientes de ella. Dio inicio a su negocio cuando su madre que viajaba al país vecino de Guatemala le mandaba ropa y fue ahí que vio la oportunidad de tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad ya posee 30 años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio. Lesbia sueña con formar una empresa donde comercialice un producto nuevo y sea solo ella quien lo oferte y satisfaga la demanda en el mercado.
Lesbia requiere de un préstamo para comprar más ropa como pantalones, camisas, shorts, vestidos y cosméticos como vanidades, lápiz de ceja, pintura labial entre otros productos y obtener buenas ganancias así de esta forma poder hacer crecer su negocio, y lograr adquirir una tienda en el mercado local del país. Sus principales metas son la recuperación de su cartera de negocio para que un futuro tener suficiente capital y ser una persona autosuficiente para dejar de adquirir préstamos en los bancos o micro financieras.
texts.en:
Lesbia is a woman who sells clothing. She is the mother of two children who are now independent. She started her business when her mother traveled to the neighboring country of Guatemala and sent her clothing. This was her opportunity to have her own business. Now she has 30 years experience in this type of business. Lesbia dreams of forming a business to sell a new product where she is the only one to offer it and satisfy the demand in the market.

Lesbia needs a loan to to buy more clothing like pants, shirts, shorts, dresses and cosmetics like compacts, eye shadow, lipsticks, etc. With it she can make good income and in this way expand her business and mange to acquire a store in the local market. Her main goals are to recoup her working capital so that in the future she has sufficient capital and is a self-sufficient person so she doesn't need to get loans from banks of micro-finance organizations.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like pants, shirts, shorts, dresses and cosmetics like compacts, eye shadow, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes, oranges and other items.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 2 years, she has operated an open air business selling food. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan of 10,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with six kids, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hassan operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. He sells vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES he wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, bar soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. 

Jane will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of cooking fat, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cooking fat, soap and other items

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 65 years old. She lives with her granddaughter in the small village of Kvareli district. 

Larisa is involved in agricultural activities. She grows fruits and vegetables on family owned land and uses them to feed the family. She wants to have stable income and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 600 GEL to open a small shop in her village. She will be able to generate income and will improve her living conditions. Larisa awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a shop in her village in order to generate monthly income.

loans.name: Dorca

texts.en:
Dorca is a widowed woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as self reliable. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. 

Dorca will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will make progress in business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Edwar

texts.es:
Edwar tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el Sector Alcaparrosa que pertenece al distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicios de transporte por mototaxi, realizando esta actividad desde hace 2 años, adicionalmente trabaja como operario en molino de arroz encargandose del pilado de arroz ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertir en arreglos de su mototaxi y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edwar is 26 years old and lives in the sector of Alcaparrosa in the District of Pucara. This peaceful community has a warm climate. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaen Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Edwar provides transportation services with his motorcycle taxi. He has been in this business for two years. In addition, he works as a rice mill operator and is in charge of hulling rice. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2,000 PEN so that he can invest in repairs to his motorcycle taxi. This will enable him to generate additional income so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle taxi repairs.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre trabajador, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive en San Martin junto a su familia.
Tiene 3 maravillosos hijos por quienes da la vida y que son su mayor orgullo. Jorge vivió toda su vida en la chacra por lo que desde pequeño ayudó a su familia con los cultivos y ya tiene una amplia experiencia en agricultura. Desde hace muchísimos años se independizó y tiene sus propios terrenos en los cuales cultiva principalmente el cacao, ahora está innovando con el plátano y café, le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace.
Para esta temporada Jorge necesita realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de cacao es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias a esto podrá realizar el mantenimiento, limpieza, etc. de estos y así en la etapa de cosecha obtener buenos ingresos. Con esto seguirá esforzándose para apoyar a sus hijos a seguir una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jorge is a hardworking man. He is 53 years old, married, and lives with his family in San Martin. Jorge has three wonderful children who give him life and are his greatest source of pride. He has lived his entire life on a farm. At a very young age, he helped his family with the crops so he has a great deal of experience in farming. Jorge has been independent for many years and has his own land. His main crop is cacao, but now he is integrating bananas and coffee. He is doing very well because he always puts forth effort in everything he does.

Jorge needs to maintain his cacao crops during this season. For this reason, he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because their assistance will enable him to maintain his crops, clear his fields, and perform other duties. As a result, his harvest will result in good earnings. Jorge continues to support his children so that they can continue toward a professional degree.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his cacao crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Iris Yesenia

texts.es: Iris, tiene 40años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en un sector que pertenece al municipio de san Pedro Sula, Cortes. Ella se dedica a la costura y venta de mercadería para generar sus ingresos. Este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años en su casa, ofrece los servicios de costura en elaboración de vestidos, faldas, trajes y otros y también vende ropa. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Esta solicitando un quinto ciclo de préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para invertirlo en el taller de costura en compra de telas y accesorios para elaborar ropa y cumplir con los pedidos.Su plan es ampliar su negocio y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Iris is 40 years old and a single mother with two children. She lives with her family in a sector within the town of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Iris works as a seamstress and also sells merchandise in order to generate an income. For the past five years, she has operated her business out of her house. She offers sewing services by producing dresses, skirts, suits, and other garments. Iris also sells clothes and has always worked in the retail trade.

She is requesting her fifth loan, which is in the amount of 15,000 HNL. Iris will invest in her sewing workshop by purchasing fabrics and accessories for making clothes, which will enable her to fulfill her orders. Her plans are to expand her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and accessories for making clothes.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a mother of one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rachel has operated a retail shop business for the past three years selling household consumables like wheat and maize flour from home to her neighbours. She faces the challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Rachel dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, and cooking fat and oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, and cooking fat and oil.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is a 43-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, growing crops like maize, tomatoes and onions as his only source of income. He faces challenges of limited capital to expand his business by buying more land for farming. His dream is to complete his semi-permanent house.Bosco needs a loan to harvest his maize to sell.

loans.use: to harvest his maize to sell.

loans.name: Rey De Jesús

texts.es:
Al llegar a cuarto año de la secundaria, Rey de Jesús se vio en la necesidad de dejar el colegio debido a problemas económicos y cambiarlos por herramientas para arreglar bicicletas y ejercer solando para ganarse el pan de cada día. Al pasar el tiempo se dio cuenta que era algo que también le apasionaba, por lo que decidió estudiar mecánica a los 21 años de edad y emprender en su negocio como mecánico y soldador para empaparse en el tema. Ahora, a sus 50 años de edad, ya tiene, ya tiene 30 años ofreciendo este servicio, el cual ha servido desde el inicio como apoyo para sustentar a sus cuatro hijos de las edades de 27, 26, 24 y 19. 
Actualmente, Rey de Jesús solo tiene una persona a cargo, la cual junto con su familia siempre le ha apoyado. Su meta es seguir creciendo y poder tener un espacio en el mercado oriental para poder ofrecer este servicio, pero primero necesita seguir invirtiendo, por lo que necesita de un préstamo para comprar herramientas para mantenimiento de su máquina de soldar. Lo que le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio y escalar hasta dónde quiere llegar, pues su meta es dejarles un negocio estable a sus hijos. Entre sus planes está ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
On reaching his fourth year of secondary school, Rey de Jesús found himself needing to leave school due to his financial problems. He swapped his studies for tools to fix bicycles, and applied himself at welding to earn his daily bread. Over time he realised that it was something he also loved doing, so at 21 years old he decided to study mechanics and start his own business as a mechanic and welder to immerse himself in the subject. Now, at 50 years old, he has been offering these services for three decades. From the beginning, this work has been his means of support and has enabled him to maintain his four children, who are 27, 26, 24 and 19 years old.

Currently, Rey de Jesús has just one person working for him, together with his family who have always helped him. His goal is to keep growing, and to have a space in a large local market to ply his trade, but first he must keep on investing in his business. He therefore needs a loan in order to buy tools to maintain his welding machine. This will allow him to offer a better service and expand as far as he wants to meet his goals, with the aim of passing on an established business to his children. He also plans to extend his home.

loans.use: to buy tools to maintain his welding machine.

loans.name: Narida

texts.en: Narida is a 55-year-old woman. She and her husband have been married for 34 years and have two children, a daughter and a son. Both of her children are married and her son’s family lives with Narida and her husband. They are from Fuzuli city but now Narida’s family lives in the Seyidahmadli village of the Fuzuli region as refuges.  Narida has been in the animal breeding business for many years and this profession is widespread in these areas. Narida prepares dairy products (milk, cheese, yogurt, and etc) which she sells to earn money. To buy two more calves, Narida needs 2,100 AZN. She says thank you to Kiva organisation for the help.

loans.use: to purchase two calves.

loans.name: Agape 3 Group

texts.en:
The group, Agape 3, will begin its sixth cycle with ID-Ghana.  The group is made up of three members. The businesses that the members have are varied, among them are: cosmetics, a food joint and seamtress services.

The loan that is being requested will benefit this small group of entrepreneurs, where Aminatu is a member. She mentions that this is the sixth time she has worked with ID-Ghana.  She joined because of an invitation from a client of the institution that visited her at her home. Currently she has a business selling cosmetics which she started many years ago. She learned how to sell cosmetics from her mother, and when she got married she decided to use this trade as a way to make money.

The requested loan is to buy cosmetics at wholesale to then sell to customers. This work allows her to generate the means to support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she stated that she likes the life assurance the institution offers.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics at wholesale to then sell to customers.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентине — 44 года, у нее двое несовершеннолетних детей. Она работает воспитателем в детском доме «Материнка», очень любит детей.  Валентине не хватает собственных средств для того, чтобы купить путевки на оздоровление детей от соцстраха. 
На 5 000 гривен Валентина планирует приобрести путевки для оздоровления детей. В будущем она мечтает окончить ремонт в квартире и выучиться на логопеда для работы с детьми в учреждении, где работает на данный момент.
texts.en: Valentina is 44 years old and has two underage children. She works as a teacher at the "Materinka" kindergarten and loves children very much. Valentina does not have enough of her own money to purchase vacations for improving her children's health. Valentina plans to use 5,000 hryvnia to purchase vacations for improving her children's health. In the future, she dreams of finishing repairs in her apartment and study to become a speech therapist to work with children at the place where she works at now.

loans.use: to buy two vacation packages for her children

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he repairs bicycles. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy and populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more bicycle spares. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life.

loans.use: buy more bicycle spares.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Esra's  group's $3,000 loan helps a member to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия живет в Фастове, Киевской области. Она — замужем, у нее две взрослые дочери. Занимается торговлей мужской и женской обувью, мужскими свитерами и футболками. Работает Наталия на местном центральном рынке. В бизнесе она работает 18 лет, опыт работы у нее — колоссальный. У Наталии — собственный торговый павильон. 
На сумму в 10 000 гривен Наталия планирует закупить сезонную зимнюю обувь. Со временем планирует расширить ассортимент и количество товара и доделать ремонт в доме. Наталия — аккуратная, умелая, спокойная, взвешенная и воспитанная женщина. Она умеет вести и хозяйство дома, и собственный бизнес.
texts.en:
Nataliya lives in Fastiv in the Kiev region. She is married and has two grown daughters. She is involved in selling men's and women's shoes, and men's sweaters and t-shirts. Nataliya works at a local central market. She has been in this business for 18 years and has a colossal work experience. Nataliya has her own retail pavilion.

Nataliya plans to use a sum of 10 000 hryvnia to buy seasonal winter shoes. With time, she plans to expand the selection and quantity of merchandise and complete repairs at home. Nataliya is an accurate, capable, calm, leveled and well-raised woman. She can run the household and her own business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal footwear for retail sale

loans.name: Falida

texts.en: Falida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of which go to school. She takes care of additional family members (brothers and their daughter). She operates a grocery store at the market. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 12 years and works six days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shilling 800,000 to buy trays of eggs, crates of soda, sweets, biscuits, cooking oil and other kinds of juice. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs and electricity which increases her operational costs. Her goal and aspirations is to buy a plot of land and also to own a fully stocked kiosk .She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, biscuts, sweets, eggs, cooking oil, beans and juice.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Kanéblapa Group

texts.es: Dona ALbani es una mujer con 48 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos, los cuales cursan la secundaria. Ella es una integrante del banco mujer que busca la superación personal y el crecimiento de su negocio. Se dedica a su actividad hace muchos años, debido a que siempre ha sido madre soltera y ha tenido que velar por la manutención de su familia, porque no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre de sus hijos. Ha luchado sola para sacar adelante a sus hijos y que ellos puedan estudiar. Ha obtenido dos créditos en la Fundación y se han caracterizado por su excelente comportamiento de pago y responsabilidad. Al igual que en los créditos anteriores ella va invertir en comprar perfumería y joyería, le ha ido muy bien gracias al buen trato y facilidad de pago que le brinda a sus clientes. Junto con Albani, hay dos socias más que van a invertir en la porcicultura y la confección de prendas de vestir. Todas buscan obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y las de sus familias.
texts.en:
Albani is 48 years old, single and a mother to secondary school-aged children. Albani is a member of a women's communal bank and her group is looking to do better in life and to expand their businesses. Albani has had her business for many years. She has always been a single mother and has had to work to look after her family as she receives no support from the father of her children. Albani has fought alone to help her children to get ahead and to be able to study. She has had two loans from "Fundación Mujer" and is known for being responsible and paying back her loans.
