As with her previous loans, Albani will invest this loan in perfumes and jewellery. Her previous loans have been good for Albani, as she offers her customers good service and easy payment options. 

Alongside Albani, two others will use this loan: one will invest in a business raising pigs; the other in a clothes-making business. All of the group's members are looking to increase their incomes in order to improve their own and the families' living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: perfumes and jewellery.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Kadzo dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans.

loans.name: Night

texts.en: Night is a married woman and has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells soft drinks and snacks. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of soft drinks and snacks. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: buy more stocks of soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Nereo

texts.es: Don Nereo con mucha experiencia en su trabajo como maestro de obra para la municipalidad, aprovecha sus conocimientos y los pone en practicas en su vivienda lo cual se ahorra el pago de mano de obra para realizar algún trabajo de albañilería, necesita el crédito para comprar los materiales como cemento, piedras canteras, arena, Hierro, cerámica, y super Bond para instalar cerámica a su vivienda y levantar una pared vertical que le falta entre el baño y el cuarto que construyo con el crédito anterior que actualmente es un solo cajón.  El es el único sustento en su hogar por lo que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar su pequeño proyecto y expresa que solo con este financiamiento podría hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en: Nereo has a lot of experience as a workman for the city. He uses his knowledge and puts it into practice at home, allowing him to save on the cost of labour when he needs to do building work. Nereo needs this loan in order to buy materials, such as cement, quarry stones, sand, iron bars, ceramic goods and Bond for putting up the ceramic goods in his home and to build a wall between the bedroom and bathroom. This bedroom was built with Nereo's previous loan. Nereo is the only wage-earning in his household and does not have enough money to carry out this little project on his own. He says that, with this loan, he would be able to make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to lay down a floor and build a wall between the bathroom and bedroom.

loans.name: Vladislav

texts.ru:
Владислав совмещает две работы, обеспечивая свою семью: официально работает поваром в военной части своего городка и неофициально фасовщиком на частном предприятии «Прогрессор». Хотя Владислав и молод, ведь ему только 22 года, он, тем не менее, работает на двух работах, чтобы обустроить собственную жизнь и воплотить свои мечты в жизнь. А в его планах на будущее — сделать свадьбу, приобрести автомобиль и собственное жилье. 
Сумма в 9 000 гривен понадобилась Владиславу для того, чтобы начать осуществлять свои планы. Он хочет добавить средства КИВА к собственным сбережениям и приобрести автомобиль, на который ему частично не хватает денег.
texts.en:
Vladislav combines two jobs to provide for his family. Officially, he works as a cook at a military base in his town, and unofficially, as a packer at a private company, called "Progressor." Even though Vladislav is young - he is only 22 years old - he, despite his age, works two jobs to set up his own life and make his dreams come true. His future plans are to hold a wedding, buy a car and his own place.

Vladislav needs a sum of 9 000 hryvnia to start realizing his plans. He wants to add Kiva funds to his own savings and buy a car that he does not have enough money to buy.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La socia Miriam se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Miriam continues to work at her business selling clothes. She sells trousers, blouses and t-shirts. She has had the business for a number of years and it is going very well for her. Miriam's dream is to have a bazaar. She is applying for this loan in order to buy shoes, t-shirts, jumpers and blouses.

Miriam is very happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, t-shirts, jumpers and blouses.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has 3 children aged between 3 and 9 years old. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes and construct a business stall. Her business goal is to have a boutique shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes and construct a business stall.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attends school and are under her care. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lucy has operated a clothes selling business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es:
La socia Cesarea se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cesarea has a business selling beauty products. She sells lipstick, creams and perfumes, working from 8am until 7pm. Cesarea has had the business for a number of years. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her beauty products. Cesarea is applying for a loan in order to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

Cesarea is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda se sigue dedicando la negocio de venta de celulares y también vende recargar de saldo para celulares, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de celulares y recargas. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar celulares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda continues to work at her business selling mobile phones and top-ups. She works from 8am until 5pm. She has had the business for a number of years and it is going well. Hilda's dream is to expand her business. Hilda is applying for this loan in order to buy mobile phones.

Hilda is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.es:
La socia Eufracia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de automoviles y motocicletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en esten negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar llantas,espejos y tornillos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eufracia continues with her business selling spare parts for cars and motorcycles. She works from 8am until 6pm. Eufracia has had the business for seven years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the business. Eufracia is applying for this loan in order to buy tyres, mirrors and bolts.

Eufracia is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy tyres, mirrors and bolts.

loans.name: Yeredon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YEREDON 1 est constitué de 7 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 8 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à GOUANA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Ils sont à leur  1er prêt avec l’institution.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de DAOUDA, le 1er homme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 350.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  de gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Yeredon 1 group is made up of seven married men who are on average 45 years old with eight children. They all live in polygamous families in Gouana, one of the villages in Bougoni in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming activities in the winter.
This is their first loan from the institution.
Daouda, the first man standing in the photo on the right, grows corn.
With his loan he plans to buy products for the earth, seeds, and to pay for the labour and hoeing costs for the exploitation of two hectares.
After the harvest he will sell the production in the village, at the market, to a mixed clientele.
He hopes to make a profit of 350.000FCFA per field.
This profit will enable him to reimburse his loan and to manage the daily expenses for his family.

loans.use: to buy products for the earth, seeds, and to pay for labour and hoeing costs.

loans.name: Wotsa

texts.fr: wotsa est mariée et mère de quatre(4) enfants dans le quartier de Bè. Elle est âgée de 37ans et exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1998. Pour diversifier son activité, wotsa y ajoute la vente d’igname et du maïs. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois à Tsévié et Tabligbo, des villes situées à l’intérieur du Togo et revend  sous un hangar à domicile.wotsa sollicite un prêt pour faire plus le stock de 65 bols de maïs et 2 calebasse d’igname afin de faire des bénéfices considérables.
texts.en: Wotsa is married with four children and she lives in the Bé district. She is 37 years old and has been selling general grocery items since 1998. To diversify her business, she has added corn and yams to the products that she sells. She buys her stock three times a month in Tsévié and Tabligbo, two towns situated in inland Togo. She makes her sales under a lean-to at her home. Wotsa requests a loan which will enable her to buy the additional stock of 65 bowls of corn and two yam tubers thus to make considerable profits.

loans.use: to buy 65 bowls of corn and two yam tubers.

loans.name: Lue Group

texts.en:
Lue is a group which is comprised of four women and a man from Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Adela is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. Her oldest child is five years old and the youngest one is two years old. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Adela's husband is the sole breadwinner. His income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Adela's house lacks of a refrigerator, and she can't afford this. Inside the kitchen of her house, she puts many kinds of drinks and sweets where they need to be in a cold condition. Particularly, the climate becomes very hot in the summer season. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a refrigerator in order to keep all the drinks in a cold condition. This affects most drinks negatively. As a result, most of those items expire quickly. So, she puts them in the litter bin. For this reason, Adela is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a refrigerator to keep the drinks and water in a cold condition in the house. 

Adela looks forward to furnishing her house with all new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep the drinks and water in a cold condition in the house.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La socia Herminia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Herminia continues running her hardware store, where she sells goods such as nails, paint and wire. She works from 8 am to 7 pm, and her business, which she has had for several years, is going very well. Her dream is to expand the hardware store.

Herminia is seeking a loan in order to buy merchandise. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as nails, paint and wire.

loans.name: Ibeth

texts.es:
La socia Ibeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos de motocicletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos de motocicletas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas, espejos y parabrisas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ibeth continues to earn her living with her business selling motorcycle parts. She works from 8 am to 7 pm. She has worked in this trade for five years, and she is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business.

Ibeth is seeking a loan in order to buy parts such as tyres, mirrors and windscreens. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts such as tyres, mirrors and windscreens.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es de la Ciudad de San Ignacio, es una persona que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, su meta es poder tener su título y poder tener un buen puesto de trabajo.
Quiere ayudar a su familia y es por ello que está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de tesis, ya que así cubrirá ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Ramon is from the city of San Ignacio. He is a person who strives in order to get ahead. Ramon is studying for a degree in Commercial Engineering. His goal is to have a degree so that he can obtain a good job.

Ramon wants to help his family, so he is trying to improve his living conditions and those of his loved ones. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for his thesis, which is an outstanding expense that he must cover.

loans.use: to pay his thesis expenses.

loans.name: Claudia Yamileth

texts.es: Doña Claudia, estudio hasta bachillerato (high school) y formo su grupo familiar muy joven, por lo que luego de recibir capacitaciones comunitarias sobre la elaboración de pan frances (asi se llama el pan que se consume como acompañante del desayuno tradicional salvadoreño), su negocio tiene 2 años. Distribuye su pan en la zona en la que habita, que le compran su pan el sabor que le da. Ella solicita apoyo para comprar harina, levadura, azucar, grasa vegetal, para la producción de pan. en la fotografia se puede observar junto a una estructura metalica que permite la colocación del bollo de pan sin cocer, en los que reserva por 6 horas hasta que la levadura realiza su tarea de incrementar su tamaño. luego de ese tiempo, lo coloca en el horno, para cocerlo y luego de 1 hora aproximadamente obtiene los bollos de pan. la utilidad que obtiene es del 40%
texts.en:
Doña Claudia studied through high school and started a family at a very young age. Sometime later, she received training in her community on how to prepare French bread (which is the type of bread that is known for being served with a traditional Salvadoran breakfast).

Claudia has been in business for two years. She distributes her bread within the area where she lives and people buy it for its flavor. Claudia is requesting assistance so that she can buy flour, yeast, sugar, and vegetable shortening for making bread. In the photograph, she is standing next to metal trays that are used to collect uncooked bread rolls, which have to sit for six hours so that the yeast can help the bread to increase in size. Afterwards, the bread is placed in the oven to cook and the rolls are ready in about an hour. The profit margin she generates is 40%.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Adan Alberto

texts.es: Don Adan, es agricultor de granos basicos (maiz y maicillo) desde hace 2 años. ese conocimiento lo adquirio de su padre y abuelo, quienes se dedican a la agricultura de subsistencia de la zona. en la fotografia se puede observa a Don Adan, posando junto a sus cultivo de maiz. el solicita apoyo para insumos agricolas para lograr el desarrollo esperado de las mazorcas de maiz y maicillo, que se tiene que realizar en la fecha indicada para lograr buenos resultados. de las utilidades obtenidas cubre los gastos de alimentacion, vivienda y vestido para su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo
texts.en:
Don Adan is a farmer who has been growing staple crops, such as corn and sorghum, for two years. He learned the trade from his father and grandfather, who were local subsistence farmers. In the photograph, Don Adan is standing next to his corn crops.

He is requesting assistance so that he can buy farming supplies in hopes that the sorghum and ears of corn develop. As of this date, Adan says that he has been able to achieve good results. The profit he earns is used to cover expenses such as food, housing, and clothing for his life companion and their young son.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his corn and sorghum crops.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio Guillermo se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura y ganaderia, el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,trigo y papa, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermo continues to work at his agriculture and livestock business. He has a plot of land where he grows corn, wheat, and potatoes. Guillermo works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. He has been in business for several years and is doing very well. His dream is to expand his agriculture business.

Guillermo is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea comenta que gracias a su familia y a su apoyo está donde hoy está, quiere poder salir adelante y retribuirles todo lo que han hecho por ella.
Está estudiando la carrera de fisioterapia, ya que de esa forma podrá convertirse en una profesional útil y que pueda ayudar a sus semejantes. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Andrea says that she’s where she is today thanks to her family and their support. She wants to be able to get ahead in life and pay back everything they have done for her.

She is studying towards a degree in physiotherapy, since she wants to be able to become a useful professional and help her fellow men. She is requesting this loan so she can pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es alumna culminante de la carrera de derecho, tiene un buen promedio, ya que se está dedicando mucho para poder salir adelante.
Vive con su familia, y comenta que se ve de aquí a un tiempo y con la ayuda de su profesión podrá ascender en su trabajo y seguir ganándose el sustento como lo viene haciendo.
Su aspiración es tener su título y ser una profesional exitosa. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma estar más cercar de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Adriana is a student finishing a degree in law. She has a good grade average as she is spending a lot of her time studying in order to be able to get ahead in life.

She lives with her family, and she says that she will leave here in a while and, with the help of her degree, be able to climb the career ladder and continue earning money to support herself.

She aspires to have a degree and be a successful professional. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in covering the costs of getting her degree so she can be closer to achieving her goals.

loans.use: to cover the costs of getting her degree

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix comenta que su meta es convertirse en una profesional destacada, que con todo el esfuerzo y dedicación por el cual ha luchado siempre dará sus frutos.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de ella quiere poder servir a las demás personas y poder sentirse útil. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de la universidad, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Felix says that his goal is to become a distinguished professional and that all the effort and dedication with which he has strived to achieve this goal will produce results.

He is studying towards a degree in accounting. He wants to use his degree to be able to serve other people and feel useful. He is requesting this loan in order to pay his university fees and, in this way, be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos está estudiando la carrera de Arquitectura, comenta que su mayor inspiración es la de abrir su propia empresa constructora.
Él quiere trabajar de manera individual e independiente, ya que son varios hermanos y quiere poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Él está esforzándose y lucha por poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación, agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Carlos is studying towards a degree in architecture. He says that his greatest inspiration is that of opening his own building company.

He wants to be self-employed, as he has several siblings and he wants to be able to help his family through his work. He is striving to be someone in life. 

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in covering the costs of getting his degree. He is grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to cover the costs of getting his degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda no estudió por motivos de escasos recursos económicos, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería, tiene 5 hijos, 2 que están estudiando viven con ella y los otros están casados.

Rosalinda tiene 25 años de experiencia en la venta de comida, ya que ella tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de la ciudad, ella decidió dedicarse a este trabajo ya que su mamá cuando estaba pequeña la inducía a este tipo de actividad y vio que es un buen medio para obtener ingresos para el hogar. 


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materia prima para su negocio de venta de comida, pues quiere ofrecer más variedad y mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Ella a futuro desea tener un negocio en buenas condiciones, que le permita brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así poder obtener una mejor rentabilidad de su negocio para cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalinda was unable to get an education due to a lack of economic resources.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture and livestock farming.  She has five children, two of which attend school and live at home.  The others are married.

For 25 years Rosalind has been running a food stall in the city market.  She decided on this line of work because her mother encouraged it when she was young.  She saw that it was a good way to make a living and earn income for the household.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials for her business, as she wants to offer a wider variety and better service to her customers.

In the future she aspires to a better situation that allows her to improve customer service to make her business more profitable so she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her food business, to offer a wider variety and better customer service to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, sand and gravel, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es: El señor juan es una persona preocupada por el desarrollo   de su familia de profesión  Lic. en biología, actualmente se  desempeña como maestro de educación secundaria en un núcleo educativo rural donde vive desde hace 14 años de laborar, es casado con 2 hijos a su cargo los cuales  les brinda el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo académico este señor se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para construcción  de cuarto, piso baño, y repello ya los materiales  que va utilizar para realizar esta obra son los siguientes: hierro 3/8 y ¼, ladrillos, piedrín, arena, piedrín, zinc, tablas  reglas, golosos .,clavos y cemento, tubos pvc, codos, inodoro, cerámica y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Juan is someone who is very concerned about his family's development.  He has a degree in Biology and currently works as a high school teacher at the rural education where has been for 14 years.  He is married and has two children, and gives them all they need to develop academically.  

Juan has visited Ceprodel to request a loan to build a bathroom and put up drywall. He will use the loan to buy iron, bricks, gravel, sand, metal sheeting, wood panels, screws, nails, cement, pipes, tiles and a toilet.  This is to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as iron, bricks, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, wood panels, screws, nails, cement, pipes, tiles and a toilet.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina has owned and operated her business for three years now. She has previously accessed and repaid a loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her processing and selling frozen food products.

She would like to take out a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 18,000 to buy different items such as dish washing liquid, fabric conditioner, powder detergent, and other products for her business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Angelina hopes to expand her business and operate her own factory; for she desires to give her children a better life. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship* and from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products such as dish washing liquid, fabric conditioner, powder detergent, and other products for her retail business.

loans.name: Teodolinda Yanileth

texts.es: Doña Teodolinda tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de articulos de primera necesidad que ofrece a los clientes de la localidad. Esta actividad tiene mas de 5 años de ejercerla, de los cuales ha recibido apoyo de la empresa para sostenerla. En esta oportunidad solicita apoyo para comprar mas mercaderia y abastecerse para ofertar a sus clientes. En la fotografia se puede observar posando con parte de la mercaderia de su tienda
texts.en: Teodolinda has a small business selling basic necessities that she offers to customers in the area. She has been running this business for more than 5 years, during which she has received the support of the business to sustain it. At this time she is asking for support to purchase more merchandise and stock it to offer her customers. In the photograph, she is seen posing with part of the merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fafavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de six(6) enfants, Fafavi   est âgée de 34 ans et réside à Adidogomé. Elle est revendeuse du sucre, sels, des détergents et des produits divers. Fafavi  s’approvisionne deux(02) fois par mois au marché d’Adidogomé Asiyéyé et revend dans le même marché.Fafavi  sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son stock de 1 sac de sucre et 2 sacs de sel dans le but de répondre aux besoins de ses clients et augmenter son bénéfice.
texts.en: Married and mother of six children, Fafavi is 34 years old and lives in Adidogome.  She is a reseller of sugar, salt, detergent, and other products.  Fafavi buys her supplies twice a month at the Adidogome Asiyeye market and resells in the same market.  Fafavi is asking for a loan to increase her inventory by one bag of sugar and two bags of salt so that she can meet her customers' needs and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar and two bags of salt.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.fr: Célibataire, âgée de 27 ans, Rebecca a deux(2) enfants en charge et habite le quartier d'adidogomé. Revendeuse de chaussures hommes et dames depuis 2002, elle est rentré dans la préparation et vente de savon locale et des produits de beauté. Rebecca achète au grand marché de Lomé et  revend par la vente ambulante dans  les environs de son quartier de résidence. Elle sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce en diversifiant le choix des chouchous, des maquillages et talc afin de satisfaire sa clientèle  et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Rebecca is single and 27 years old. She has two children as dependents and lives in the neighborhood of Adidogome. She has been a reseller of men's and women's shoes since 2002.  She also prepares and sells local soap and beauty products.  Rebecca buys her supplies at the central market in Lome and resells as a traveling saleswoman. Rebecca is asking for a loan to grow her business by diversifying the selection of scrunchies, make-up, and talc to satisfy her customers and earn more of a profit.

loans.use: to buy scrunchies, make-up, and talc.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат добрая женщина. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Саноат окончила Медицинский колледж. Она работает более 15 лет в больнице медсестрой. Так как Саноат получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами, она начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Доход, который она получает с бизнеса, использует для обеспечения семьи, со всеми необходимыми средствами. Саноат должна купить сено для скота, но данное время она не имеет денег. Саноат является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж не имеет собственного источника дохода. Он помогает ей введению бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки сено. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sanoat is a good woman. She is married, but does not have any children. Sanoat finished medical college. She has worked as a nurse in a hospital for more than 15 years. As Sanoat receives a small pay, and this pay is not enough for providing her family with everything necessary, she started her own livestock breeding business. She uses the income she receives from the business to provide her family with all things necessary. 

Sanoat needs to purchase fodder for the livestock, however currently she does not have the money for it. Sanoat is the main bread-winner in the family, as her husband does not have his own source of income. He helps her in managing the business. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni to purchase fodder. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock fodder

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose Antonio se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos (maiz y maicillo) y ademas jocote (para exportación como integrante de una cooperativa que envian estos productos al mercado nostalgico ubicado en USA, aunque los ingresos que percibe son bajos ya que los reparten entre todos los miembros de la cooperativa). En la fotografia se puede visualizar a Don Jose junto a sus plantas de maiz a medio crecimiento, que necesitan una aplicacion de insjmos agricolas para lograr el resultado esperado. con las ganancias de dicho cultivo, mantiene a su familial. El pide apoyo financiero para comprar los insumos agricolas que necesita.
texts.en: José Antonio works growing basic grain (corn and millet) and, in addition to jocote (for export as a part of a cooperative that sends these products to an ethnic market located in the USA, although his income seems low since it is shared among all the members of the cooperative). In the photograph, José can be seen with his half-grown corn plants, that need an application of agricultural products to produce the expected result. With the profits of this crop, he supports his family. He asks for a loan to purchase the agricultural supplies that he needs.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate basic grains.

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es: Doña Maria Maura se dedica a la preparación de alimentos tipo antojitos salvadoreños (comida tipica) desde hace 4 años. en la actividad le ayuda su nieto adolescente, quien ademas le apoya en la comercializacion con los vecinos. Ella forma parte de un programa que Integral realiza con una Fundación que da asesoria tecnica para que las personas que habitan en comunidades periurbanas vulnerables al riesgo social por la situación delincuencial, puedan autogestionarse ingresos. Integral le ha apoyado con creditos a traves de los cuales ha ido incrementando su capacidad de producción. En la foto se le puede observar con paquetes de chocolate criollo (resultado de procesar granos de cacao, azucar, canela) que forma parte de las bebidas mas consumidas para el desayuno y tardes. Ella pide que se le apoye para comprar materiales para producir ese y otros productos que vende a sus vecinos
texts.en: María Maura has worked making typical Salvadoran snacks for the past 4 years. Her teenage grandson help her in this work, and also supports her in selling them to the neighbors. She is part of a program that Integral conducts with a foundation that gives technical advice so people who live in the vulnerable suburban communities, at risk both socially and criminally, can create their own income.  Integral has helped her with loans through which she has increased her production capacity. In the photo, she can be seen with packets of local chocolate (processed from cocoa beans, sugar and cinnamon) which are part of the most popular drinks for breakfast and in the afternoons. She asks for support to purchase materials to make this and other products that she sells to the neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make snacks.

loans.name: Marlene Margarita

texts.es: Doña Marlene Margarita, tiene una tienda en la que vende articulos de primera necesidad, que comercializa en un espacio dentro de su vivienda. Con el 21% de ganancias que obtiene, sufraga gastos de su hogar, compuesto por sus 2 hijos quienes aun tienen gastos de estudios. En la fotografia se pueden observar parte de su mercaderia, que principalmente son huevos, pan, azucar, papel higenico, detergentes. Ella solicita apoyo para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Marlene Margarita has a store in which she sells basic items, which is located in her home. With the 21% profit she makes, she pays for the expenses of her household, which is made up of her two children who still have education costs. You can see part of her merchandise, which mainly comprises eggs, bread, sugar, toilet paper and detergent. She is requesting help to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.ru:
Анатолий — из Берегово, ему 33 года, он не женат. Он 2 года занимается своим бизнесом, торгует продуктами питания, как, например, сладостями, хлебом, колбасными изделиями, молочными продуктами, пивом, консервами и кашами, а также предоставляет услуги кафе, арендуя помещение возле заправки прямо в центре города. 
Сумма в 35 000 гривен нужна ему для закупки товара, продуктов питания длительного хранения. Анатолий недавно приобрел автомобиль и у него после этой покупки осталось совсем немного средств на товар. Однако деньги нужны для того, чтобы разнообразить ассортимент и держать бизнес на уровне.
texts.en:
Anatolyi is from Beregovo. He is 33 years old. He is not married. For two years he has had his own business, selling food products such as sweets, bread, sausages, dairy products, beer, canned food and cereals. He also has a cafe. He is renting premises near the gas station in the center of the city. 

Anatolyi needs an amount of 35,000 hrvynia to purchase goods, food with long shelf life. Anatolyi bought a car not long ago, and after this he has very little money for purchasing goods. However, he needs money in order to diversify his assortment and keep the business at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase food products with long shelf life

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant, âgée de 28 ans, Massan habite le quartier d’adidogomé. Massan exerce le commerce comme activité en vendant  Efio (souche) par la vente ambulante dans  les environs de son quartier de résidence. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au Ghana, un pays voisins situé à l’ouest du Togo.Massan  sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son commerce avec 34 bols de souche afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Massan is single and childless. She is 28 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Adidogome.  Massan sells Efio (tiger nuts) as a traveling saleswoman in the vicinity of the neighborhood where she lives.  She buys supplies once a month in Ghana, a neighboring country to the west of Togo.  Massan is asking for a loan to grow her business by 34 bowls of tiger nuts in order to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy 34 bowls of tiger nuts.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Ларисе 53 года, она состоит в разводе. Лариса работает в обществе с ограниченной ответственностью, занимающимся комплексной уборкой, а также подрабатывает в местном ЖЭКе. Живет в собственном доме. Сейчас у Ларисы дома проходит ремонт: шпаклевкой покрываются стены, сняты регистры и трубы отопительной системы, приобретен котел. 
Дополнительные средства в размере 25 000 гривен понадобились Ларисе для того, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия дома, а именно, завершить ремонт системы отопления: закупить и проложить трубы и установить отопительные алюминиевые регистры до начала отопительного сезона. Лариса надеется довести дом до ума до начала холодов. Она умело справляется с хозяйством, делает ремонт, заботится о престарелой матери. Во всем трудолюбива, аккуратна и хозяйственна.
texts.en:
Larisa is 53 years old and she is divorced. Larisa works as a cleaner for a limited liability company, and she also at the local Housing office. She lives in her own house. Currently Larisa is doing renovation to her house: Covering walls with putty, removing the registers and pipes of the heating system and purchasing a boiler. 

Larisa needs the additional 25,000 hryvnia in order to improve the living conditions of her house, specifically to complete the repair of the heating system. She needs to purchase and lay pipes and install aluminum heating registers before the heating season starts. Larisa needs to bring the house in order before the cold weather comes. She was able to manage the household, do renovations and take care of her elderly mother. She is very hardworking, tidy and economical.

loans.use: to finish the renovation of the heating system in her house

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: Don Jose Alfredo tiene tienda ubicada en casa, que atiende junto a su esposa y 4 hijos. Esta ubicada en la calle principal, por lo que presenta una alta rotacion de sus productos. la utilidad de su actividad es del 38%. el ofrece productos de primera necesidad, entre ellos granos basicos, bebidas, alimentos congelados, carnes, etc. en la fotografia posa con una parte de su inventario. el solicita apoyo para la compra de mas mercaderia
texts.en: José Alfredo has a store, located in his house, that he runs with his wife and 4 children. It is located on the main street, for which he shows a high product rotation.  The profit from his business is 38%. He offers basic products including basic grains, drinks, frozen foods, meat, etc. In the photograph, he poses with a part of his inventory.  He asks for a loan to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Don Victor Manuel, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en vehiculo de su propiedad. esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años. la rentabilidad que obtiene es del 33%, que le permiten sufragar los gastos de u hogar (compañera de vida y 2 hijos). en la fotografia se le puede ver posando junto a su vehiculo. el pide apoyo para comprarle llantas y cambiar aceite para el motor y otros insumos
texts.en: Victor Manuel works transporting passengers in a vehicle he owns. He has done this work for the past 8 years. The profit that he gets is 33%, which permits him to cover the household expenses (life partner and 2 children).  In the photograph, he can be seen posing with his vehicle. He asks for support to purchase tires and change the motor oil and for other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase tires and repairs for his vehicle's motor.

loans.name: Kriscia Belitza

texts.es: Doña Kriscia Belitza, tiene 4 años de tener su tienda, en la que vende articulos de primera necesidad para los vecinos de su localidad. con las ganancias mantiene a su familia compuesta por 2 pequeños hijos. En la fotografia puede observarse parte de la mercaderia que ofrece a sus clientes. Ella solicita apoyo para comprar mas mercaderia y obtener ganancias para la subsistencia de su familia.
texts.en: Kriscia Belitza, has had her store for 4 years, in which she sells basic products to the neighbors of her neighborhood. With her earnings, she maintains her family, made up of 2 small children. In the photograph, part of the merchandise she offers her customers can be seen. She asks for support to purchase more merchandise and to earn income to for her family's subsistence.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan Carlos, ofrece transporte de pasajeros desde hace mas de 5 años. obtiene un 44% de ganancia en la actividad, que le permiten sufragar los gastos de su hogar compuesto por su compañera e hijos aun en edad de estudio. El solicita apoyo para reparar su taxi y seguir brindando el servicio de transporte. en la fotografia se observa junto a su unidad de transporte
texts.en: Juan Carlos has offered passenger transportation for more than 5 years. He gets 44% profit in this work, which allows him to cover the household expenses of his partner and children who are still school-aged. He asks for support to repair his taxi and to continue offering his transportation service. In the photograph, he can be seen with his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Doña Haydee tienen una tienda en la que vende articulos de primera necesidad. realiza esta actividad desde hace 14 años, con una rentabilidad del 20%, que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos. en la fotografia se le ve junto a su mercaderia de su tienda. ella pide apoyo para abastecer su inventario.
texts.en: Haydee has a store where she sells basic products. She has done this work for the past 14 years, with profits of 20%, which has helped her get ahead with her 4 children. In the photograph, she is seen with the merchandise in her store. She asks for support to stock her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Blanca Dolores

texts.es: Doña Blanca Dolores, tiene un chalet desde hace 2 años, lo tiene ubicado en escuela cercana a su domicilio. obtiene un margen de ganancias del 20%, con cuyos ingresos mantiene a sus 2 pequeños hijos. En la fotografia puede observarse junto a la camara refrigerante en la que almacena las bebidas frias y las golosinas que ofrece en el chalet. ella pide apoyo para abastecerse de mercaderia que ofrece a los clientes.
texts.en: Blanca Dolores has had a food stall for the past 2 years. It is located in a school near her home. She gets a profit margin of 20%, with which she supports her 2 small children. In the photo she can be seen next to the cooler where she stores cold drinks and the snacks she offers in the stall. She asks for support to stock the merchandise that she offers her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her food stall.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: Don Jose Roberto, tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y comercialización de productos lacteos (queso fresco, queso duro, crema) y otros que sus clientes demandan (miel de abeja, entre otros). la actividad le genera un margen de ganancia del 20% con el que sostiene su hogar. En la fotografia se puede observar parte de su producto que exhibe en vitrina de vidrio ya cortado y listo para vender (queso duro). el pide apoyo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de dichos productos.
texts.en: José Roberto has worked for more than 4 years making and selling dairy products (queso fresco, hard cheese, cream) and other products that his customers request (honey among others). This work generates a profit margin of 20%, with which he sustains his household. In the photograph, one can see some of the products he displays in the display case, cut and ready to sell (hard cheese). He asks for support to purchase the raw material used to make these products.

loans.use: to purchase raw material used in making dairy products.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas de 54 años de edad, es un hombre cuya historia contaremos por medio de estas pequeñas palabras, él es un agricultor que junto a su esposa han luchado y apoyado mutuamente,  procrearon 9 hijos entre los que destacan su hija mayor que es un apoyo muy grande para la familia, por lo tanto esto se debe a que tanto  Leonidas como su esposa han hecho un buen trabajo en crecer a sus hijos por ello hoy son gente de trabajo.  

Leonidas realiza la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo cual tiene mucha experiencia en lo que hace, ya que su abuelo le enseño el trabajo a la perfección y por ello él lo desempeña muy bien.


El préstamo se empleara para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para cultivar en esta temporada. Cultivando los granos básicos para su propia alimentación, ya que de lo contrario seria mas difícil estarlos comprando.

Sus planes a futuro son con respecto a la agricultura, comenta que esta un poco preocupado por la eventual sequía que atraviesa el país, pero que confiá en Dios que todo habrá de solucionarse; pero manifiesta que sus planes son muchos, pero sobre todo uno tener siempre su cosecha por la cual cada año trabaja con mucho esfuerzo, porque así tiene segura la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 54 years old, and we are going to tell his story in these few words. 

He is a farmer who, with his wife, has fought and given mutual support. They have nine children, among whom the eldest daughter stands out as she is a great support to the family. This is due to the fact that Leonidas and his wife have done a good job in raising their children, who are hard-working people today.

Leonidas has been a farmer for many years, so he has a lot of experience in what he does. His grandfather taught him his work perfectly and for this reason, he does it very well.

He will use the loan to buy maize seed, compost, pesticides and weed killers to grow during this season. He is growing them for his own consumption, as it would be more difficult for him to buy them.

As regards his future plans and farming, he says that he is slightly worried about the drought affecting the country, but he places his trust in God that everything will work itself out. He has many plans, but his main one is to always have his harvest, which he works hard for every year, because in this way he can ensure his family have enough food to eat.

loans.use: to buy maize seed, compost, pesticides and weed killers to grow during this season. He is growing them for his own consumption, as it would be more difficult for him to buy them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase new furniture and home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Busime/murhesa Group

texts.fr: Madame Ntakwinja, mère de 6 enfants empruntant tous le chemin l’école est membre de l’association de crédit Busime/Murhesa. Agée de 52 ans, elle est Veuve.  Dès son mariage à l’âge de 18 ans elle s’était spécialisée dans la commercialisation des médicaments. Aujourd’hui propriétaire d’une pharmacie, elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 10 boites de paracétamol, 3 boites d’indocides et 4 boites de papavérine. Elle a comme objectif de  nourrir ses enfants,les scolariser et ainsi elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes entrepreneurs en milieu rural.
texts.en:
Ntakwinja has six children, who are all in school, and is a member of the Busime/Murhesa credit group. She is 52 years old and widowed.

Since her marriage at the age of 18, she has specialized in selling medication. Today she owns a pharmacy and is requesting this new loan to buy ten boxes of paracetamol, three boxes of Indocid and four boxes of Papaverine.

Her aims are to be able to feed her children and send them to school. She therefore thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs living in rural areas.

loans.use: to buy ten boxes of paracetamol, three boxes of Indocid and four boxes of Papaverine.

loans.name: Estrellas De Wara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE WARA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cesaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de celulares, venta de salchipapas, venta de comida, venta de verduras, artesanías en madera, compra y venta de mantas, costura de edredones, venta de chinelas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cesaria es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de chinelas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años al observas que era un producto que podía ser comercializado constantemente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chinelas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ESTRELLAS DE WARA” community bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II centre. It is made up of eight members and managed by board of directors chaired by Señora Cesaria. The members of the community bank run various businesses, including selling mobile phones, hot dogs and chips, food, vegetables, and wooden crafts, and buying and selling blankets, sewing duvets, and selling sandals.

The loan they take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs including Señora Cesaria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago, after being invited by a friend who is a member of the organisation. She currently has a business selling sandals. She explains that she set this business up on her own initiative a number of years ago, after noting that it was a product which would always have a market. 
 
The loan she is going to take out now is to increase capital (to buy wholesale sandals) which she will get from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. She will then sell them in her sales outlet. This way of work allows her to make money to support her family financially, as she has a partner and five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the healthcare area offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sandals.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en: Rogers is a 31-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in rentals and mobile money businesses. He started these businesses with an aim of employing himself, but he faces challenges of competition and poor network service. The mobile money business depends on the network. Fewer customers means reduced sales. Besides that, he hopes to fully furnish his rentals business. Rogers needs a loan to open up more mobile money outlets.

loans.use: to open up more mobile money outlets.

loans.name: Jibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Machozi est présidente de l’association de crédit Jibu.  Agée de 52 ans, elle mère de 6 enfants dont seulement 5 sont scolarisés et mariée à un homme sans emploi. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 7 sacs de 100kg de manioc. Son ambition est de devenir fournisseur de la farine de manioc et de mais. Ainsi, elle remercie beaucoup Hekima de soutenir les femmes.
texts.en: The customer, Machozi, is president of the Jibu loan association. She is 52 years old and mother to six children, of whom only five are educated; she is married to an unemployed man. She is requesting a loan to buy seven 100 kilo sacks of cassava. Her ambition is to become a supplier of cassava flour and corn flour. She is very grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to women.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of cassava.

loans.name: Joyeuse A Group

texts.fr: Musukali est une brave commerçante depuis 12 ans, vice présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Joyeuse A», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 5 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse divers articles de friperie, elle étale son business dans le marché du centre ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 3 ballons de friperie. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu des parents de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Musukali is a good and honest merchant. For twelve years, she has been the vice-president and a member of a business collective called “Joyeuse A”.  She is a senior entrepreneur, 50 years old, and a married other of seven children, of whom two are students, and five are married. She sells a variety of secondhand clothing and has a stall for her business at the market downtown. 

Musukali is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 3 bales of secondhand clothing. Her husband is unemployed. She started of with funds from her husband’s parents. For the future, she wishes to build a house and provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for having chosen a good goal bringing support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system while according them no-collateral loans.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert used his previous loan to renovate the business premises of his metal fabrication workshop. He is still in the business of selling electronics and video CDs. He is facing challenges of limited capital. However, he has hopes of buying another piece of land and expanding his business into new markets to increase his sales and profits. Robert needs a loan to floor his house.

loans.use: to construct a floor for his house

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 38-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in transport business using a lorry tipper. He also farms and makes bricks. He faces challenges of competition and poor roads during rainy seasons. He hopes of buying lorry for transport. He needs a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his house

loans.name: Bunjojo Sacco Group

texts.en: Joshua used his previous loan to weed his garden. He has continued with the same business of growing food crops such as maize, beans, onions, and sorghum. He is faced with hardships of limited capital and weather changes. Besides that, he hopes of improving his enterprise. Joshua needs a loan, through his group, to help him improve his garden by weeding and harvesting. This being a re-listing loan, this cycle only 14 members applied for the loan, the rest are resting.

loans.use: to help him improve his garden by weeding and harvesting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, costura de mandiles, servicio de transporte, venta de jugos, tejido de guantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar que su amiga elaboraba estos productos solicita que le enseñe y decide emprender su negocio independiente hace doce años. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ROSALES” community bank will begin its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima regional centre. It is made up of eight members and managed by a board of directors chaired by Señora Claudia. The members of the community bank run various businesses, including weaving blankets, sewing aprons, offering transportation services, selling juices, and knitting gloves.

The loan they take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs such as Señora Claudia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, after being invited by a friend who is a member of the organisation. She currently has a blanket handicraft business. She explains that she set up this business on her own initiative after seeing that her friend made these products. She asked her to teach her and decided to establish her independent business two years ago.
 
The loan she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wholesale wool), which she will get from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. After making the blankets, she will sell them in her sales outlet. This way of working allows her to make money to support her family financially. She is married and has nine children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the savings offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement and paint to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Joyeuse B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kaghoma est une doyenne commerçante et membre d’une banque villageoise «Joyeuse B», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants, dont 4 étudient et 5 sont mariés.  La cliente est vendeuse des pagnes ordinaires. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 33 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 28 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, accroitre son activité, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en: The customer, Kaghoma, is an elderly trader and member of the "Joyeuse B" Banc Villageois. She is a dynamic entrepreneur who is 55 years old, married and mother to nine children, four of whom are studying and five of whom are married. The customer sells ordinary "pagnes" (brightly-colored pieces of fabric). She lays out her goods in a town market. She has been carrying out this business for 33 years and benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima later on. Her husband is unemployed. This new loan will be used to buy 28 pieces of "pagne" fabric. She would like to buy a plot of land, expand her business and educate and feed her children. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy 28 pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Amani Kwetu Group

texts.fr: Hangi est commerçante et membre da la banque communautaire «Amani Kwetu», entrepreneur, âgée de 26 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 1 est encore petit. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché  de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de Hekima. Son conjoint est  un maçon. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1.5 sac de pommes de terre et 5 régime de bananes.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Hangi is a trader and member of the "Amani Kweti" community bank. She is 26 years old, married and mother to three children, two of whom are studying and the other still very small. The customer sells food products and lays out her goods in a town market. She began her business with funds from Hekima. Her husband is a mason. She has been carrying out her business for four years and this new loan will be used to buy one and a half sacks of potatoes and five bunches of bananas. She would like to be able to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks, particularly during this critical post-conflict period in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy one and half sacks of potatoes and five bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Gloire Du Seigneur Group

texts.fr: La cliente Buganaba est une commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Gloire du Seigneur», entrepreneur, âgée de 42 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants, dont 7 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. La cliente est vendeuse d' haricots. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu après récolte de son champ. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1.5 sac d’haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The customer, Buganaba, is a trader and member of the "Gloire du Seigneur" business group. She is an entrepreneur who is a 42-year old widow and mother to eight children, seven of whom are studying and one who is still a small child. The customer sells beans and lays out her goods in a town market. She began her business with funds from the harvesting of her field and has now been carrying out this business for 20 years. This new loan will be used to buy one and a half sacks of beans. She would thereby like to be able to educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks, particularly during this critical post-conflict period in the eastern region of the country..

loans.use: to buy one and a half sacks of beans.

loans.name: Kanaka Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Lili is the leader of a group that lives in Muniguda in the district of Rayagada, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 48 years. She has a small family comprising four members: her husband and one son and one daughter, aged 15 and 17 respectively. The member standing second from the left with a raised hand is Lili. 

Like most families in the locality, she and her husband are running a grocery shop in Muniguda town. She sells rice, dal, tea, sugar, chocolate, etc. in her shop. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Lili’s son is assisting her to run the business smoothly by purchasing grocery items from the nearby town. At present, her family income is Rs. 5,000 per month from the grocery shop, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti. From the loan amount, she will purchase grocery items in bulk quantity to avail a cash discount and also save transportation costs, which she incurs frequently. She has a dream to have a wholesale shop in the town and educate her children in a better college in the town.

The other three members of her group are doing individual businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Mugusu Twimuke Tukole Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of Mugusu Twimuke Tukole Group. He is married, age 45, and has 12 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He deals in brick making and selling fresh foods like yellow bananas, avocados, mangoes, passion fruits, and tomatoes, among others. He faces challenges of perishability of his stock. However, he is hoping to build a permanent house. 

Joseph needs a loan to add to his fresh food business by buying more mangoes, passion fruits, oranges, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to add to his fresh food business by buying more mangoes, passion fruits, oranges, and  tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Abifaisi

texts.en:
Abifaisi is 38, married and has seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After realizing that farming can assist in meeting her home daily expenses, especially in contributing school fees for her children, she is determined to work hard in growing more cocoa to make sure the standard of living for her family is well improved. 

She hopes to have all her children achieve higher levels of learning, though high school fees with limited income hinders her progress. 

She wants a loan to buy cocoa for selling to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Sahar Group

texts.en: This group is called Sahar. It consists of three women from Dhamar, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. Iman is a sweets maker who lives with her family in Dhamar. She is the leader of the group. Iman is a 30-year-old widow with five children. Her oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest one is four years old. For three years, she has been making different kinds of sweets in a small store. It is her only source of income. Her sweets are famous for its delicious taste and you can always buy hot, fresh sweets from her store. This is why she always has a lot of customers. Iman wants to expand her business. She wants to buy another new  oven and equipment for making the dough in bulk for the sweets. In order to accomplish this goal, Iman requested a loan of 50,000 YER that she plans to use to buy the equipment for the sweets and the oven for her store. Iman looks forward to making all kinds of sweets and she hopes to expand her business more by opening a large sweets store to meet all the demands of the customers.

loans.use: to buy the sweet equipment and oven for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cements and bricks to renovate the house and build new rooms.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a hardworking married man with four children between 18 and 8 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in produce, selling coffee and beans as his main source of income, though he also practices farming where he earns an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces challenges of competition, price fluctuations and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern store of produce and having educated children.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and beans to sell.

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a widow, age 63, with two adult children. She also lives with four grandchildren.

She is a farmer who gets additional income from selling second-hand clothes. She started her business to raise income to take care of herself. Limited capital hinders her business. 

She is an honest and hardworking woman who will use the loan to plough two acres of land to plant maize and buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to plough two acres of land to plant maize and to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en:
Yowasi lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 52 and married, and he has 10 children aged between 24 and 32. Three of these attend school. 

He owns a general merchandise shop selling sugar, soap, salt and detergents. He started his business to increase his income. 

He is a hardworking man who will use the loan to buy more sugar, soap, salt and detergents.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, salt and detergents.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 33, married and has five children between 5 and 12. Four of them attend school. 

He buys and sells maize and makes extra income from bodaboda (bicycle transport) and farming. He started his business to make extra income. His major challenge is competition. 

He is hardworking and will use the loan to buy more maize.

loans.use: to buy more maize.

loans.name: Sharone

texts.en:
Sharone is a 34-year-old married lady with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She deals in maize and banana farming alongside selling second-hand clothes. She started these businesses with a hope of raising income. She faces challenges of limited capital, but she hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. 

Sharone needs a loan to harvest maize.

loans.use: to harvest maize.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 34-year-old single mother with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has operated a bar since 2013 and works 17 hours a day and seven days a week. She began the business to have a stable source of income. Jane is a hardworking woman with the idea of expanding her business, although she is faced with a challenge of seasonality, which brings scarcity of money. 

Jane wants the loan to buy a freezer to enable her to serve customers cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to enable her to serve customers cold drinks.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
A Sra. Cristina de 35 anos de idade casa e mãe de 4 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario, sustenta  sua mae e sua irma. Ela è negociante informal de produtos  da 1ª necessidade a mais de 12 anos, actividade que esta a explorar junto com seus filhos e com ajuda financeira  do seu esposo que trabalha nas minas da vizinha Africa do Sul.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar  material de construcao (blocos, cimento, janelas, portas, tintas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Cristina is 35 years old and has four children who are in elementary and high school. She also helps to support her mother and sister financially.

Cristina has worked for more than 12 years selling basic necessities. Her children help her in this effort and her husband, who works in the mines in the neighboring country of South Africa, also helps out financially.

With this loan she would like to continue with her home construction project by buying supplies like blocks, cement, windows, doors, paint, and by paying workers to help with the construction.

loans.use: buy construction supplies like blocks, cement, windows, doors, paint, and to pay workers to continue construction of her house.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is a 42-year-old married man with four children between 11 and 5. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer, though he also deals in produce, selling to earn an extra income. He started this business to earn a living. He faces a challenge of pests and diseases, but he has a dream of becoming a modern farmer.

He is accessing credit to buy manure for his plantation and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy manure for his plantation and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.pt:
O Sr. Arnaldo 58  anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundário. Ele è supervisor na empresa de produção  de banana a mais de 6 anos e è tambem negociante informal de produtos da machamba na sua casa, actividade que esta sendo acompanhada pela sua esposa
O presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, barrotes, area,cimento, varrões  e pagamento de mao de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Tem com   grande desafio melhor as condicos de habitacao e a dieta almentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 58 years old and is married with 3 children, all of whom are in elementary or high school. 

For more than six years he's worked as a supervisor for a commercial banana farm, and he also works selling products grown on his own small farm from his house with the help of his wife.

With this loan Arnaldo would like to continue with a home construction project by buying blocks, cement, sand, metal bars and posts, and also paying workers to help with the building. His main goal is to improve the living conditions and diet of his family.

loans.use: buy blocks, cement, sand, metal bars and posts, and pay workers to help with the building of his house.

loans.name: Alcidio

texts.pt:
O Sr.Alcidio de 24 anos de idade, casada e pai de 1 filhos que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele è empacotadora de banana na empresa de produção de banana a mais de 3 anos 
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, varroes  e pagamento de mão de obra.) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Alcidio is 24 years old and is married with one child who is in elementary school. For more than three years he has worked for a commercial banana farm as a packer. 

Alcidio will use this loan to buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and posts, and to pay workers to continue with the building of his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials like blocks, cement, and posts, and pay workers to continue with the building of his house.

loans.name: Zaveria

texts.en:
Zaveria is a 66-year-old hardworking man with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He deals in farming, growing crops like banana and onions, alongside a retail shop and a bar in order to boost his income. He faces challenges of limited capital and weather changes. However, he has hopes of improving his income and completing his residential house. 

Zaveria needs a loan to complete his residential house.

loans.use: to complete his residential house.

loans.name: Jobran Al- Orok Group

texts.en:
This group is called Jobran Al- Orok. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Anisa is a 35-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group. Anisa is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and active. She works as a housewife. Anisa has a lot of housework. Her house lacks a washing machine, and she always washes the family's clothes with her hands. This work makes her very tired. Anisa cannot afford this condition.
