She asked her husband to buy a washing machine for the house in order to help her with the clothes. Unfortunately, the income of her husband is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Anisa applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine. 

Anisa looks forward to building a second floor and renting the first one in order to make a better future.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to help her to wash clothes.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima, age 34, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is single with a responsibility of taking care of three children between the ages of nine and 14.

Naima sells maize and beans and is a hard working woman who desires to expand her business. 

However, debtors affect her business. She is acccessing a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Al-Safa Thaban Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Safa Thaban. It consists of six women. They all live in traditional and simple families in  the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB. 

Safa is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She is the leader of the group. Safa lives with family in their own house. She is an educated woman. Safa is a very dynamic and vigorous woman. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. In time, he accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. Safa supported him with a lot of her own money. Many years ago, Safa and her husband built their own house on the land they bought. Now the family lives in their own house, but it is not completed and the kitchen of the home is very small. As a result, Safa is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement and steel irons in order to build another large kitchen for the house.

Safa looks forward to opening a savings account in AMB in order to help her build a second floor.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks, cement and steel irons in order to build another large kitchen for the house

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Doña Anabel, tiene una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, u sus principales clientes son las colonias de habitantes en la zona, escolares que asisten a las escuelas y empleados que laboran en la zona, realiza la actividad desde muchos atras, con cuyas ganancias mantiene a todo su grupo familiar y le permite cubrir gastos de educación, vestimenta y alimentación, para su grupo familiar compuesto por su esposo e hijos. En la fotografia se puede observar a Doña Anabel en su negocio, rodeada de alguna mercaderia. ella pide apoyo para comprar mas articulos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Anabel has a store in which she sells convenience store items. Her main customers are from the neighborhoods in the area, students who attend the schools, and workers who work in the area.

She has had this business for quite a while. With the earnings, she supports her whole family and covers the costs of education, clothing, and food for her family, which is made up of her husband and children.

In the photo, Anabel can be seen at her business, surrounded by some merchandise. She is asking for support to buy more items to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Evelin Beatriz

texts.es: Doña Evelyn, es agricultora, que siembra cereales (frijol y maiz) y tambien aprovecha la temporada para sembrar hortalizas (tomate, chile, cebollas, hierbas aromaticas, papa) y asi tener ingresos con un periodo mas corto que los cultivos tradicionales. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 4 años, dado que ella es quien lleva el sustento a su hogar para sus hijos. Ella pide el apoyo para comprar insumos y lograr la cosecha de sus hortalizas. en la fotografia se puede observar el crecimiento del cultivo en su primera etapa (ella realizo la inversion inicial en semillas, con la ganancia del otro cultivo).
texts.en:
Doña Evelyn is a farmer who plants beans and corn. During this season, she also plants tomatoes, chilis, onions, herbs, and potatoes. This allows her to have income with a shorter period than traditional harvests. She has done this work for four years, since she maintains the household for her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies and reach the harvest of her vegetables. In the photo, you can see the growth of her crop in the first stage. She made her first investment in seeds with her earnings from another crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for vegetables.

loans.name: Om- Mohammed Group

texts.en:
Om-Mohammed is a group included four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.
	
Shams is the leader of the group.  She is a 34 years old married woman with three children.  Shams studied till the Elementary school, but she couldn't complete her study. 

Shams's husband is an employee in a public sector. He is very dynamic and works hard to improve the living standard of his family.  The salary which he receives is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Shams's house lacks a refrigerator.  Shams needs to keep drinks, food, sweets, and vegetables and water cold.  Her climate Particularly, the climate is very hot during summer months.  As a result, most of those foods and drinks expire quickly. 

Shams is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase a refrigerator for her house.

Shams looks forward to improving her family.  She hopes to open a saving account with AMB.  Her dreams are to furnish her house with new furniture and appliances.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for their house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 58-year-old married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a general store where she earns a living, though she also owns rentals to earn herself an extra living. She started this business to look after her family. She faces challenges of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and low demand, while her dream is to diversify her business.

Rose intends to use the loan to buy more salt, paraffin, sweets and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt, paraffin, sweets and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with 4 children whose ages range from 2 years to 7 years. She describes herself as disciplined. She operates a retail business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Pauline will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Betty is 18 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past four years, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential items like sugar, rice, beans and maize flour. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items for sale, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and buy food for the family. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a supermarket. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential items for sale

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 24-year-old married man. He is a farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. However, he has a problem because every time he wants to water his land, he has to borrow water from his neighbor. 

Karam needs your financial support. He is requesting a loan in the amount of AZN 1200. With this money, he plans to buy tools to build a sluiceway. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for the loan.

loans.use: to buy tools to build a sluiceway

loans.name: Amistad-Paucartambo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMISTAD-PAUCARTAMBO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marizol ella es soltera y tiene 39 años y tiene 1 hijos; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este trbajo y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para un televisor para su casa.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the AMISTAD-PAUCARTAMBO [Friendship-Paucartambo] community bank. This bank is located in the district of Paucartambo, belonging to the Paucartambo province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Marizol. She is single, is 39 years old, and has 1 child. She works as an elementary school teacher from 8:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. She has been doing this work for several years, and it is going very well for her.

Her dream is to have a grocery store. She is applying for the loan to buy a television set for her house.

The other members make their living in the handicraft sales business, the animal sales business, the grocery store business, and the restaurant business.

The member is grateful to whomever forms part of this dream through the loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television set for her house.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be good. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are the general public. 

Agatha describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in demand. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a chemist's where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Catherine will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. Her business goal is to own another chemist's outlet within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance. Her previous loan was repaid  successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukobelwa est une commerçante, trésorière et membre d’une plate forme d’affaires «Tuchukuliane», entrepreneur, âgée de 38 ans, mariée  et mère de 10 enfants, tous étudient. La cliente est  une vendeuse des légumineuses. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un agent dans un hôtel de la place. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter les amarantes, chou, les aubergines, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mukobelwa is a merchant. She is a member and the treasurer of the business group Tuchukuliane. She is an entrepreneur, 38 years old, married, and a mother of ten children. All of her children go to school. 

Mukobelwa has been selling vegetables for twenty years. She displays her goods in a town market. She started this business with funds from her husband, who works at a hotel in the area.

This new loan will serve to buy amaranth, cabbage, eggplants, etc. 

Mukobelwa would like to educate, clothe, and feed her children.

To finish, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping women who lack access to banking services become independent; especially during this critical post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy amaranth, cabbage, eggplants, etc

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman with no children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting too long to repay goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Cecillia

texts.en:
Cecillia is married. She has owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past six years, Cecillia has been renting houses. Her potential customers are tenants. Her major challenge is seasonality in the business.

With the requested loan of KES 50,000 she wants to paint her rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to paint her rental house

loans.name: Amnia Group

texts.en:
The Amnia group consists of four women who live in Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Fathia is the leader of the group. She is a 47 years old, married, mother of three children.  They live in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. 

Fathia is a very active and dynamic woman who works at home.  Her husband is an employee in a public sector but his income is not enough to cover all family expenses.  They don't have enough food.

Fathia applied for a loan of 20,000 to purchase food such as flour, sugar, meats, potato, and tomato, and other food to nourish her family.

Fathia looks forward to improving the living standard of her family. She hopes to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for the house as flour, sugar, meats, potato, and tomato, and other food materials in order to face all the demands of family's needs from the food inside the house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Rose is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past year, Rose has been working hard to manage her food stall where she sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables for sale, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and buy food for the family. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to own a beauty salon. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a female Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of finances. 

Florence will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to grow into a big restaurant within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a quality life and more profits. She will use the anticipated profits to open a bigger hotel (restaurant).

loans.use: to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Liliana Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Liliana Esmeralda, se dedica a la venta de frutas (piñas, bananos, naranjas) y otros articulos que los clientes le piden por temporadas (sandalias, bolsas, canastas, etc); los que coloca en un pequeño lugar sobre la acera, en una zona de alto trafico de personas. sus productos son preferidos por la frescura. En la fotografia se pueden observar algunas de las frutas ofrecidas. Ella solicita apoyo para comprar mas mercaderia.
texts.en: Liliana Esmeralda works by selling fruit (pineapple, bananas, oranges) ad other items that her customers request for the season (sandals, bags, canastas, etc.), which she places in a small area in the sand in a high-traffic area. Her products are preferred for they freshness. In the photo, you can see the fruit she offers. She is requesting support to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cristoalina Bernard

texts.es:
Doña Cristobalina es una señora con 74 años de edad, viuda, humilde y muy trabajadora. Vive sola a la par de una nieta nieta la cual ve como una hija. Hace ocho años falleció su esposo. Desde ese momento vio la necesidad de trabajar en su casa para generar ingresos y poder mantenerse. Inició con una pulpería y con la cria de animales. Actualmente necesita un financiamiento para invertir en el comercio de ropa tanto de mujer como de hombre. Tiene en la sala de su casa la ropa que excibe para su venta, y sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y hermanos de la misma congregación a la que ella asiste. Tiene muchos clientes debido a que no cuenta con competencia en su comunidad, ya que es rural. Su nieta le ayuda en los oficios domésticos y en su negocio.
Éste es el tercer préstamo que solicita y lo va invertir en comprar más variedad de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes. En sus créditos anteriores se ha caracterizado por la buena moral de pago. Su objetivo es superarse y crecer, necesita sentirse ocupada, por eso tiene varias actividades productivas, que le van a permitir cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Cristobalina is a 74-year-old widow who is humble and hard-working. She lives alone with a great-granddaughter who she sees as a daughter. Her husband passed away eight years ago. Since then, she saw the need to work from home to earn income to support herself. She started a grocery store and started raising animals. Currently, she needs a loan to invest in selling women's and men's clothing. She has a room in her house that she uses for sales. Her customers are her neighbors, family, and members of the congregation she attends. She has many customers because she doesn't have competition in her community, since it's rural. Her granddaughter helps her with domestic work and the business.

This is the third loan she is requesting and she wants to invest in buying a variety of clothes to offer to her customers. From her previous loans, she has been characterized as a good payer. Her goal is to succeed and grow. She needs to feel busy, which is why she does various productive activities that allow her to complete her goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

Eunice will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to own a wholesale charcoal shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a piece of land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance. Her previous loan was repaid  successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Abarondezi Group

texts.fr:
Isidore  fait partie du groupe  Abarondezi et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 35 ans et est marie a Jeannette, une cultivatrice.  

Elle fait le commerce des habits  depuis  6 ans. 

I l est a son cinquième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité des habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir un nouveau logement.
texts.en:
Isidore is a member of the Abarondezi group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 35 years old and is married to Jeannette, a farmer. He has been selling clothing for six years. 

Isidore is on his fifth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothing to resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like a new home.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothing to resell

loans.name: Eneida

texts.es: Doña Eneida es una señora con 49 años de edad, vive con dos hijos y con su compañero.  Uno está estudiando en primaria y el otro en la Universidad. Vive en una comunidad rural y no hay suficientes fuentes de empleo. Debido a ésto ella busca la manera de generar ingresos para poder ayudar a su hogar y al pago de los estudios de sus hijos, ya que su compañero es jornalero y lo que percibe por su trabajo es relativamente poco. Es primera vez que solicita financiamiento a la Fundación. Ella cuenta con la experiencia de criar cerdos y ahora quiere reforzar su actividad, debido a ésta situación busca un crédito. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y sacar adelante a sus hijos profesionalmente, asi mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su famila
texts.en:
Eneida, 49, lives with her partner and her two children. One is at primary school and the other is at university. She lives in a rural community where there are few employment opportunities. Because of this, she looks for different ways to generate income to help with her household bills and to pay the study fees for her children. Her husband is a laborer and receives little work. It is the first time that she has asked for a loan from the Foundation. She has experience in raising pigs and now wants to strengthen this as a business as she needs more income.

Her goal is to expand her business and help her children move forward professionally, therefore improving the lives of her and her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: Kyavaranga est commerçante d’une expérience de 3 ans, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Etoile». Elle est vendeuse des produits pharmaceutiques. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une pharmacie sur la route principale de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter de médicaments modernes (Antibiotiques, anti-inflammatoires etc.). Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un préfet des études d’une école de la place. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activié, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancables, en leur accordant de microcrédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Kyavaranga is a merchant with three years' experience and is a member of the Etoile business group. She is 40 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. All of her children go to school.

Kyavaranga sells pharmaceutical products. She displays her goods in a pharmacy on a main town road. She started this business with funds she received from her husband, who is a school administrator. Now, she is seeking a loan through Hekima in order to expand her business. She is going to buy modern medicine (antibiotics, anti-inflamatories, etc.).

In the future, Kyavaranga wishes to expand her business and feed and educate her children.

She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services by offering them loans without requiring collateral.

loans.use: to buy modern medicines (antibiotics, anti-inflamatories, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more items to resell to customers.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes hard to operate. Her dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to service her motorcycle and purchase new spare parts. She decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle and purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira is 26 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo  de 36 anos nasceu em Manjacaze, vive maritalmente na casa própria, tem 2 filhos do primeiro casameto dos quais um vai a escola e o outro sem idade de frequência, ambos não vivem com ele. 
É comerciante há mais de 8 anos, vendendo roupa de 2 mão em diversas esquinas dos mercados da vila de Magude.
Este é seu 2 financiamento na Hluvuku e antes levantou 20.000,00 para comercio e actualmente 40.000,00 para compra e venda de roupas usadas.
Tem como sonhos expandir a sua actividade comercial e melhorar as condições da sua habitação e a falta de fundos para investir em suas aspirações tem sido seu maior desafio.
texts.en: Bernardo is 36 years old.  He was born in Manjacaze.  He is married and lives in a house he owns.  He has two children from his first marriage, one of whom attends school and the other is not yet old enough.  They do not live with him.  He has been a merchant for more than 8 years.  He sells secondhand clothing on different corners of the market in Magude.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku.  His prior loan was for 20.000 for his business and this one is for 40.000 to purchase clothing for resale. He dreams of expanding his business and making improvements to his home.  His greatest challenge has been a lack of funds to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda and is married with four children who school.  Agnes takes care of additional family members.

She operates a salon and works seen days a week. She earns additional income from poultry farming.

Agnes has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO of Uganda totaling 900,000 shillings.  She will use the money to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, rollers and treatments. Her major challenge is the electricity blackouts that hinder her work. 

Her goal and aspiration is to expand her salon into a bridal salon. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy hair styling supplies.

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lissette del Socorro, posee un negocio de venta de productos derivados del maíz (Chicha) ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace quince años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos menores que están bajo su responsabilidad. Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:30 am, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 12:00 pm. Su negocio lo inicio con  ahorros.

La señora Lissette solicitó un crédito a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar al  por mayor de maíz, maní, leña, frambuesa y bolsas plásticas. Esto permitirá ofrecerle a su clientela precios más accesibles satisfaciendo la demanda, así obteniendo mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia.
texts.en:
Lissette del Socorro has had a business selling corn products (Chicha) in one of the markets in the city of León for fifteen years. She does this to support her family as she is a single mother with two young children.
She leaves her home at 5.30am to begin working at 6am and finished work at 12pm.
She started this business with her savings.

Lissette is asking CEPRODEL for a loan to buy corn, peanuts, wood, raspberries and plastic bags in bulk. This will allow her to offer her customers more affordable prices to meet demand, and so obtaining more income which will improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, peanuts, wood, raspberries and plastic bags.

loans.name: Esther A Group

texts.fr: Dongo est commerçante et membre d’une plate forme d’affaires «Esther A», entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. La cliente est vendeuse des légumineuses et épices. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un petit  marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un agent policier. Il y a 14 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter les amarantes, chou, les aubergines, tomates, oignons, poireaux etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Dongo is a merchant and a member of the business group Esther A. She is an entrepreneur, 36 years old, married, and a mother of six children. Five of the children are in school, while the sixth is still a child. 

Dongo has been selling vegetables and spices for 14 years. She displays her goods in a small town market. She started this business from funds she received from her husband, who is a police officer. 

This new loan will serve to buy amaranth, cabbage, eggplant, tomatoes, onions, leeks, etc. 

Dongo would like to buy a piece of land, build [a home] and educate, clothe, and feed her children.

To finish, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping women who lack access to banking services become independent; especially during this critical post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy amaranth, cabbage, eggplant, tomatoes, onions, leeks, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single woman who lives at a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Beatrice sells fruits and vegetables from a stall at the local market to town dwellers and neighbors.  She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality.. 

With the Kshs 30,000 Beatrice wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.  She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman and has been blessed with eight children, all of whom finished school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt:
Lina de 51 anos de idade nasceu  em Magude, vive maritalmente na casa própria. Tem 2 filhos que não vão a escola e sustenta 3 netos que vivem juntos. 
É garimpeira há mais de 20 anos, vendendo pedras preciosas extraída na associação das olarias de Mawandla em Magude.
Este é seu 1 financiamento na Hluvuku levantou 10.500,00 para compra de cimento, chapas de zinco e barrotes no sentido de fazer cobertura da sua casa.
Tem como sonhos de melhorar as condições da sua habitação e iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos alimentares de 1 necessidade, a falta de fundos para investir em suas aspirações tem sido seu maior desafio.
texts.en: Lina is 51 years old.  She was born in Magude, is married, and lives in a house she owns.  She has two children who do not attend school, and she supports 3 grandchildren who live with her. She has been a mining prospector for more than 20 years, selling precious stones extracted from the pottery associations of Mawandla in Magude.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku. She is borrowing 10.500,00 to purchase cement, zinc panels, and beams to build a roof for her home.  Her dreams are to improve her housing conditions and start a business selling staple food items.  Her biggest challenge is a lack of funds to invest in her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc panels, and beams in order to make a roof for her house.

loans.name: Neoline's Group

texts.en:
Neoline's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Noeline is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bowama in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past six months, Noeline has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells cosmetic items. 

To help expand her business, Neoline has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic lotions to sell. This will help Neoline to generate greater profits to buy basic needs for her family. Neoline hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Neoline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic lotions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for arts and crafts.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 28-year-old  woman married to John who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They are blessed with two children. Esther has been operating a clothing shop for five years, earning an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Esther was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy new designs and fashion of clothes: dresses, skirts, trousers and children's wear.

Esther plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with lots of success.

loans.use: to buy new designs and fashions of dresses, skirts, and trousers

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman who has four children, ages two to 12.  She describes herself as optimistic. 

Everline operates a retail business where she sells clothes and has been in business for three years. It is located in a good area near her primary customers. 

Everline will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes.  Her business goal is to increase income within five years. She hopes to become successful. 

This is Everline's first loan with SMEP microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both go to school. She sells green bananas  at the market, retail. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She takes care of additional family members and she gets additional income from selling piped water. 

Joyce works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of buying a delivery van to ease transportation. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and  piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man. He has 3 children whose ages range from 3 years to 9 years. He describes himself as obedient. He operates a business transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest challenge as a lack of funds. 

Evans will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a married man. He has 2 children, ages 5 years and 7 years. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Victor will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Rehema has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods purchased on credit.

With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Morphine

texts.en:
Morphine is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as successful. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area, and she has good primary customers. 

Morphine will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tailoring materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 39 years old and single with one child. Rebecca works hard to provide for her child. She runs a bags and cloth business in Ghana and requested a GHS 1,500 loan through ID-Ghana to purchase more bags and cloth to sell to customers.

Rebecca has borrowed and repaid four loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. She has been running this business for four years.

Rebecca aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to higher education.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and cloth to sell to customers.

loans.name: Linda

texts.pt:
Linda de 47 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude, viúva e vive na casa própria. Tem 4 filhos e desses 3 vão a escola e o outro já envolvido em projectos de geração de renda. Sustenta além dos filhos um neto que vivem juntos e que vai a escola. 
É comerciante há mais de 26 anos, vendendo carne de vaca a retalho
Este é seu 2 financiamento na Hluvuku e antes levantou 25.000,00 para comercio e actualmente 40.000,00 para compra 3 cabeças de gado bovino no sentido de aumentar seu volume de mercadoria.
Tem como sonhos desenvolver mais sua actividade comercial comprando uma viatura que lhe facilite o transporte das cabeças e melhorar as condições da sua habitação, a falta de fundos para investir em suas aspirações tem sido seu maior desafio.
texts.en: Linda is 47 years old.  She was born in Magude and is a widow who owns her home.  She has 4 children.  Three of them attend school and one is already working.  In addition to her children she supports a grandson who lives with them and also goes to school.  She has been a merchant for more than 26 years.  She has a retail business selling beef. This is her second loan with Hluvuku.  She previously borrowed 25.000,00 for her business and this loan is for 40.000,00 to purchase 3 head of cattle to increase her stock of merchandise.  Her dreams are to develop her business by purchasing a car that would help her transport the cattle and to improve the conditions of her home.  Her greatest obstacle is a lack of funds to invest in her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase 3 head of cattle to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Doña Blanca Lidia, se dedica a la comercializacion de medicina natural, en el mercado de su localidad. Tiene 15 años de vender estos productos, pero antes se financiaba con prestamistas, por lo que su progreso no ha sido muy alto. solicita capital de trabajo para adquirir mercaderia que es preferida por sus clientes (limpiador de colón, higado, riñones, entre otros). En la fotografia se puede observar exhibiendo parte de la mercaderia
texts.en:
Doña Blanca Lidia makes a living in natural medicine, which she sells at her town market.  She has been selling these products for 15 years, but before she was financed by private lenders, so her returns have not been very high. She is asking for capital to acquire her customers preferred merchandise (colon, liver, and kidney cleansers, among other products).

In the photograph, you can see Lidia displaying part of her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for natural medicine sales

loans.name: Santos Miguel

texts.es: Don Santos Miguel, se dedica a la produccion de camas de madera (marco y base), tablas de picar para la cocina, cepillos para lavar ropa, entre otros. Obtiene un 26% de margen de ganancia, con el que mantiene a su hogar compuesto por compañera de vida e hijo. en la fotografia se puede observar, en el piso, el sobrante de las mazorcas de maiz, que utiliza para el horno en el que realiza parte del proceso (esto evita el consumo excesivo de leña, ayudando al medio ambiente a evitar la contaminación y degradación de bosques), y los "mangos" de los cepillos de madera para lavar ropa (se usan cepillos para limpiar mugre de los pantalones de trabajo y evitar el alto consumo de detergentes haciendo mas eficiente la lavada de la ropa. El pide apoyo para la compra de insumos para la produccion de estos articulos
texts.en:
Santos Miguel makes wooden beds (frames and bases), chopping boards for the kitchen, laundry brushes and other items. He has a 26% profit margin which he uses to take care of his wife and son.

In the picture you can see leftover corncobs on the floor which he uses in the oven as part of the process (this prevents excessive firewood consumption, helping the environment as it prevents pollution and forest degradation). You can also see the handles of the wooden laundry brushes (which can be used to clean dirt from work pants, avoiding high consumption of detergents and therefore making washing clothes more efficient). 

He is asking for a loan to help him to purchase these materials to support his business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make furniture and wooden brushes.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.

Sharon sells chips at the market in the evenings. She has been in this business for the last 3 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan from MCDT - SACCO of UGX 400,000 to buy cooking oil, a bag of Irish potatoes, spices, and cabbages. Her major challenges include high transportation costs, which increase her operational costs. 

Sharon's goal and inspiration is to buy a refrigerator so she can start selling cold drinks.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and cabbages

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a married woman with five children, all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Medza wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaws

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia appreciates the previous loan that helped her to expand her business.

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, that she is requesting she wants to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is a married mother of three children who attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Mumbi has operated a food stall business where she sells to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mumbi dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to Shifta, who contributes additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Lonah has been operating an internet cafe for seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Lonah was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now requesting her first loan of KES 30,000. She intends to use this amount to buy an additional computer to add to her internet cafe.

Lonah plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and she hopes to build a permanent house in the near future.

loans.use: To buy an additional computer.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Teresia has operated a charcoal business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation.

With the requested loan of KES 50,000, Teresia wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 53 years old and single with two children. She works hard to provide for her children. She has run a vegetable business in Ghana for 31 years. Elizabeth has requested a GHS 1,600 loan through ID-Ghana to purchase more vegetables to sell. Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid seven loans from ID-Ghana prior to this loan. She aspires to save enough money to be able to provide her children with higher education.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is comprised of 2 hard-working women. Justine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 4 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her catering business, which sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking oil, charcoal, and Irish potatoes for the business. Justine hopes that the loan will help her to generate greater profits so she can assist her parents with their basic needs and also take care of her child. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a salon.

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, charcoal, and Irish potatoes for the business

loans.name: Nacmaddin

texts.en:
Nacmaddin is 33 year old, married, father of two kids.  He growsl fruits and vegetables, such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums and cherries. But, he has a problem with water because every time he has to borrow water from his neighbor in order to water his land. 

Nacmaddin needs your financial support, a loan in the amount of AZN 1200, to buy tools to help direct water to his land.  

He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy tools to build a channel to direct water to his land.

loans.name: Jaime Adonay

texts.es: Don Jaime se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos (maiz y maicillo). su grupo familiar esta compuesto por su esposa y pequeño hijo. La actividad que realiza le permite sufragar gastos del hogar pero necesita apoyo financiero para comprar insumos agricolas y aplicarselos a sus plantas y obtener los resultados esperados. En la fotografia se le ve junto a sus plantas de maiz de mediano crecimiento.
texts.en:
Jaime cultivates basic grains (corn and sorghum). He has a wife and a young son.
His business allows him to cover his household expenses, however he needs financial support to purchase agricultural products to apply them to his crops for the best results.
In the picture you can see him with his growing corn plants.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products to grow corn.

loans.name: Chirindo

texts.en:
Chirindo is a married woman with five children, all  attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a home-based soft drink  business to sell fruit juice to her neighbors and passersby. She faces challenges of changing weather conditions and the high cost of transporting raw materials. 

She wants to purchase sacks of fruit, mangoes, and passion fruit to make fruit juice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  fruit, mangoes, and passion fruit to make fruit juice to sell.

loans.name: Roxana Iveth

texts.es:
Roxana de 19 años de edad, es una joven que tiene el compromiso de un hogar y de su pequeño bebe que le ilumina la vida y sus días, su esposo esta siempre pendiente de ella y de su pequeño hijo, él sabe el compromiso que tiene y que tiene que trabajar muy duro por su pequeña familia aunque es muy joven todavía es un ejemplo para las generaciones de hoy para que así como ellos han logrado estar juntos y luchar así otros también pueden hacer la diferencia como esta joven familia.  


 Roxana es ama de casa es muy aseada y ordenada, amante de la limpieza como joven madre esta consiente de que a su bebe la suciedad le puede causar daño, así que mantiene limpio todo porque en su hogar y cuando su esposo llega le prepara el almuerzo para que continué la tarde trabajando con ganas y mucho entusiasmo. 


El préstamo se empleara para comprar repuestos para una mototaxi, ya que es la herramienta de trabajo de su esposo, que se dedica a realizar viajes. 

Los planes a futuro de Roxana, son incrementar la familia por que solo tiene un bebe, pero mejorar su vivienda es otra prioridad también que tiene junto con su esposo , ya que son una pareja joven y  los sueños y aspiraciones son muchas.
texts.en:
Roxana, who is 19 years old, is a young woman who is committed to her home and to her little baby, who lights up her life and her days. Her husband looks after her and their young son, and is aware of the commitment he has and of the need for him to work hard for their little family. Although he is still very young, he is an example for today's generation: just as this young family has managed to be together and to fight, so too can others make a difference.

Roxana is a housewife who is very neat and tidy. She loves cleaning because as a young mother she is aware that dirt can cause her baby harm, so she keeps everything clean in her home and when her husband comes home she prepares his lunch so that he can keep working eagerly and enthusiastically in the afternoon.

The loan will be used to purchase parts for a motorcyle taxi, which is her husband's tool for his job and which he uses to get around.

Roxana's future plans are to increase the size of her family, since she only has one baby, but improving her home is another priority for her and her husband, as they are a young couple with many dreams and aspirations.

loans.use: to buy parts for a motorcycle taxi, which is her husband's tool for his job and which he uses to get around.

loans.name: Obed Isrrael

texts.es:
El mundo de la electrónica siempre ha sido una fascinación para Obed, quien desde temprana edad se veía interesado en cómo funcionaban los aparatos electrónicos, razón por la que los desarmaba, analizaba el interior y los volvía a armar. Es un joven carismático, inteligente y emprendedor, cursa quinto año de la carrera Ingeniería Electromecánica en modo sabatino, tiene 21 años y está casado. Aparte de estudiar, haces dos años trabaja en una pequeña empresa donde pone a prueba todo el conocimiento adquirido, asegura que cada día es una oportunidad para aprender algo nuevo y da lo mejor de sí para lograr el éxito.  
Obed solicita el crédito para el pago de los cursos de titulación, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que al poseer un titulo logrará tener más oportunidades de trabajo y así poder progresar, de manera que  pueda ayudar a su familia en mejorar las condiciones de vida. Al mismo tiempo agradece el apoyo de su esposa y el esfuerzo de su padre, quienes lo motivan para que logre cumplir sus sueños. Una de sus metas es seguir estudiando y uno de sus planes futuros es establecer su negocio propio en el que pueda innovar con sus ideas y brindar excelentes servicios.
texts.en:
The world of electronics has always been a fascination to Obed. 

At an early age, he became fascinated with how electronics worked: he would take them apart, analyze their insides and would put them back together again. 

He is a charismatic, intelligent and enterprising young man, attending the fifth year of study on Saturdays in electromechanical engineering. He is 21 years old and married. 

Besides studying, for the last two years he has been working at a small company, where he puts to the test all his acquired knowledge. He ensures that every day is an opportunity to learn something new and to give his best to achieve success.

Obed is requesting a loan to pay for degree courses. He puts his trust in the financing since by possessing a college degree he will have more job opportunities available to get ahead, and in turn he can help to improve the living conditions of his family. Similarly, he appreciates the support of his wife and the efforts of his father, who motivate and encourage him to fulfill his dreams . 

One of his goals is to continue studying and one of his future plans is to establish his own business in which he can innovate with his ideas and provide excellent service.

loans.use: pay tuition.

loans.name: Quisito

texts.pt:
O senhor Quisito de 54 anos é militar, casado pai  de 1 filho a estudar l vive na casa própria sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Com valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, pedra, varões para a construção de sua casa 
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar  a sua obra,  fazer murro de vedação de seu quintal mobilar sua casa.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado são os financeiros para a conclusão de sua casa, e  que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar seu plano  e que nas horas vagas presta servicos de alfaiataria e machamba.
texts.en: Quisito is 54 years old.  He is in the military, and is the married father of one son who attends school.  He owns his home and supports a nephew who lives with him.  He will use the loan to purchase cement, sand, stones and bars for the construction of his home.  His dreams and projects include finishing construction, building a wall around his property and furnishing his home.  He says that the main challenge he has faced is financing to complete construction. He will continue to request loans to complete his plans, and in his free time he will provide tailoring and farm services.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, stones, and bars.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.pt:
Lurdes de 52 anos nasceu em Manhica, divorciada e vive na casa dos pais. Tem 2 filhas e ambas vão a escola, não sustenta mais alguém fora das suas filhas. 
É comerciante há mais de 25 anos, vendendo mercadorias diversas, adquiriu a experiencia dos seus pais.
Este é o seu 3 financiamento na Hluvuku e antes levantou 10.000,00 e 20.000,00 para comercio e actualmente 35.000,00 para compra de capulanas, cosméticos, bijutarias no sentido de aumentar seu volume de mercadoria.
Tem como sonhos desenvolver mais sua actividade comercial, continuar a envidar esforço no sentido de suas filhas terminarem a faculdade e construir sua própria moradia,  a falta de fundos para investir em suas aspirações tem sido seu maior desafio
texts.en: Lurdes is 52 years old.  She was born in Manhica.  She is divorced and lives in her parents' home.  She has 2 daughters who attend school and she does not support anyone else besides her daughters.  She has been a merchant for over 25 years, selling diverse items. She learned this business from her parents.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku.  He prior loans were for 10.000,00 and 20.000,00 for her business. The current loan is for 35.000,00 to purchase capulanas (sarongs), cosmetics and jewelry to increase her stock of merchandise.  Her dreams are to develop her business, to continue to focus her efforts so that her children finish college, and to build her own home.  The lack of funds to invest in her dreams has been her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to purchase capulanas (sarongs), cosmetics, and jewelry to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Ssrah

texts.en:
Sarah  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, four attend school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She has operated a retail shop at the market for 15 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested 400,000 UGX from MCDT - SACCO of Uganda  to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, crates of soda, boxes  of soap and peas. 

Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase the operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to increase her sales. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not running water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, soap, and peas.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a 29-year-old married man with three children who are  between the ages of 18 and 12 years.  

He has bought and sold  livestock for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.
	 
He has applied for his first loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy more livestock.                                                                                             

Jared will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow the business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Urukundo Group

texts.fr: Agnesi est commerçante, présidente et membre de la banque communautaire «Urukundo», entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 14 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des huiles de palmes et végétales. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un maçon. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima.Il y a plus 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 100 litres d’huile de palmes et 50 litres huiles végétales. Ainsi, elle cherche a bien fidéliser son activité, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Agnesi is a trader and also president and a member of the "Urukundo" community bank. She is an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur who is 40 years old and mother to 14 children, who are all studying. The customer sells palm and vegetable oils. She lays out her goods in a lively avenue in the town. She began her business with funds from her husband, who is a builder. Later on she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been exercising this activity for more than ten years now. This new loan will be used to buy 100 liters of palm oil and 50 liters of vegetable oils. She is thereby hoping to build up a loyal customer base, and also educate, clothe and feed her children. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for giving autonomy to female entrepreneurs who do not have access to banks.

loans.use: to buy 100 liters of palm oil and 50 liters of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en:
Ndunge is a 52-year-old hardworking woman married to Mutava, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with six children. Ngunge operates a grocery stall which has been in operation for a period of four years, earning her an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Ndunge was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a friend and is now in her first loan cycle with a loan of KES 10,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy a solar lamp.

Ndunge plans to use the profits made through the grocery business to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to become a more successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Penouel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Flotrence est une commerçante, vice présidente et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Penouel»,   entrepreneur, âgée de 31 ans, mariée  et mère de 3 enfants, qui tous scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires et sociétaire d’un magasin. Elle étale sa marchandise à l’entrée de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Il y a 11 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des farines, 50 kg du sucre, 50kg de riz, les huiles végétales, 5kg savon omo. Son conjoint est un boutiquier. Ainsi, elle compte acheter une parcelle, construire, vêtir, nourrir et scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The borrower, Flotrence, is a trader and entrepreneur. She is a member and the vice-president of the Penouel business group. She is 31, and the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. The borrower sells food; she is part-owner of a shop. She sells thoses goods at the city entrance. She started this business with funds she received from her husband. She has been in this business for 11 years. This new loan will allow her to buy flour, 50kg of sugar, 50kg of rice, vegetable oil, and 5kg of Omo washing powder. Her husband is a shopkeeper. She plans on buying a plot of land, build a house, feed her children, buy them clothes, and pay for their school fees. She is very grateful to Hekima for their help in empowering female entrepreneurs with no bank accounts, especially during this critical post-conflict time in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy flour, 50kg of sugar, 50kg of rice, vegetable oil, and 5kg of Omo washing powder.

loans.name: Giringingo Group

texts.fr:
Anitha fait partie du groupe  Giringingo et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Côme, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants dont  3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de haricot  depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot, à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Anitha belongs to the Giringingo group and lives in Gitega. She is 32 years old and married to Côme, who is a farmer. They have four children together, three of whom are studying.

Anitha has been buying and selling beans for the past four years, and she is on her fourth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans to resell, so she can make more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans to resell, so that she can earn more money.

loans.name: Kadawa

texts.en:
Kadawa is widow and a mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Kadawa has operated a coconut vending business for the past three years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Kadawa dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a mother of four children, all of whom have graduated from school and are working. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Rehema dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: María Aurora

texts.es:
Al impartir clases una sonrisa de satisfacción sobresale en la cara de María Aurora, puesto que está orgullosa de transmitir conocimientos a sus estudiantes con el objetivo de mejorar su análisis y comprensión del mundo que los rodea. Tiene 48 años, está soltera y tiene dos hijos. Es una excelente psicóloga y una docente ejemplar, que en 14 años de trabajo todos sus alumnos siempre quedan agradecidos por el buen trato y el aprendizaje adquirido. Los sábados cambia su papel de docente a estudiante, ya que cursa su último año de maestría, anhela aprender más para ser una profesional exitosa. 
María solicita el crédito para el pago de su maestría, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que un segundo título reforzará su imagen profesional, al mismo tiempo tendrá más oportunidades de ofertas laborales de manera que pueda seguir progresando. Su inspiración para seguir adelante lo son sus dos hijos, a quienes quiere brindarle salud y educación de calidad para que estos posean un futuro prospero. Es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas por cumplir, uno de ellos es establecer una clínica de atención psicopedagógica.
texts.en:
Teaching classes brings a smile of satisfaction to Maria Aurora's face because she is proud to share her knowledge with her students, with the goal of improving their analysis and comprehension of the world around them. She is 48, single, and has two children. She is an excellent psychologist and exemplary teacher. In her 14 years of working, all her students are always grateful for the good treatment and knowledge learned. On Saturdays, she changes roles from teacher to student. Since she is in her final year in a Master's program, she hopes to learn more on being a successful professional.

Maria is requesting a loan to pay for her Master's. She puts her confidence in this loan because a second degree will reenforce her professional image; at the same time, she will have more professional opportunities that will allow her to keep progressing. Her inspiration to move forward is her two children, whom she wants to provide with quality health and education so they will have bright futures. She is an enterprising woman with many goals to fulfill, one of which is to establish a psychopedagogical care clinic.

loans.use: to pay for her Master's.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena, who is a 33 year old widow, lives in the city of Bolnisi. She is the  breadwinner in her family and takes care  of a young daughter and school-aged son. 

Lena works hard to provide normal living conditions for her children, but she finds it hard. She works at a local hospital as a doctor’s assistant and generates an insignificant income. She wants to have a better standard of living and provide a  good education for her son and daughter. 

Lena requested a loan, but her request was rejected several times; but at last MFO Credo has approved her application within the start up program, to let people start or re-start businesses. 

She plans to go to Turkey, purchase bulk quantities of clothing and linens at wholesale prices and then sell it in increased prices in her community. 
This new business will greatly assist Lena in meeting daily expenses. Lena and her children rely on the good will of the lenders and highly appreciate their help.

loans.use: to start a clothing business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Pedro  de 34 anos de idade nasceu em Magude , vive maritalmente na casa dos falecidos pais. Tem um filho ainda sem idade de frequência escolar e sustenta seus avos que vivem juntos. 
É comerciante há mais de 10 anos, vendendo produtos alimentares diversos, adquiriu a experiencia dos seus pais.
Este é seu 2 financiamento na hluvuku e antes levantou 15.000,00 para comercio e actualmente 20.000,00 para compra farinha de milho.
Tem como sonhos desenvolver mais sua actividade comercial e construir sua própria moradia,  a falta de fundos para investir em suas aspirações tem sido seu maior desafio.
texts.en: Pedro is 34 years old.  He was born in Magude and lives with his wife in the home of his deceased parents.  He has one son who is not yet school aged, and he supports his grandparents who live with him.  He has been a merchant for more than 10 years, selling diverse food items.  He learned this business from his parents.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku.  He previously borrowed 15.000,00 for his business and currently is requesting 20.000,00 to purchase cornmeal.  His dreams are to develop his business and to build his own home.  His greatest challenge has been a lack of funds to invest in his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Adela del Carmen, se dedica a la actividad de crianza de ganado de repasto (engorde para luego venderlos) con el que obtiene un 33% de ganancia, que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. En la fotografia se puede observar el terreno en el que su hato ganadero realiza el repasto para engorde. Ademas de ganado bovino, tiene aves de corral (gallinas), y ganado porcino (cerdos). Ella solicita apoyo para la compra de ganado y continuar con su actividad.
texts.en:
Adela del Carmen earns a living from raising cattle, fattening them to sell them on, from which she obtains a 33% profit which has allowed her to support her family.

In the photograph you can see the land on which her herd of cattle are grazed to fatten them up. 

As well as beef cattle, she has poultry (hens) and pigs. She is asking for a loan to buy livestock and continue her work.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening up.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Judith is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bowama in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past two years, Judith has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh bananas. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods for sale, and will help Judith to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brothers. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another plot of land for farming. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods for sale

loans.name: Yambal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YAMBAL” iniciará el décimo vigésimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Liliana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de calzados, tienda de ferretería, tejido de busos, tienda de abarrotes, tienda de barrio, venta de gas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Liliana es integrante, ella indica que hace 17 años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  salón de belleza; da a conocer que este esta actividad la aprendió al estudiar en un instituto técnico, con el pasar del tiempo y un pequeño capital, decide emprender un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar económicamente a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y los microcréditos que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen una de las socias no esta presente en la imagen, ya que se encontraba en el consultorio médico realizando sus controles.
texts.en:
The YAMBAL Community Association will start the 29th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. The association is made up of eleven members and led by a board, of which Liliana is the President. The businesses run by members of the association are varied and include selling cosmetics, selling shoes, a hardware store, weaving for overalls, a grocery store, a corner store, and selling gas.

The loan they obtain will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, including Liliana. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 17 years, after joining when she was invited by a friend who is a member of the association. Today she has a beauty salon: she says that she learned about this activity by studying in a technical institute, and over time and with a small amount of capital, she decided to start her own business.
 
The loan that she will now now obtain is to be used to increase her stock (buying cosmetics wholesale), which she will acquire from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and subsequently sell in her retail store. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, as she lives with her partner and her three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the area of ​​health, training and microcredits offered by the institution. 

In the photo one of the members is not present, as she was at the doctor's having tests.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Rostalina de 28 anos de idade nasceu em Magude, e’ viúva e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta a escola e não sustenta mais alguém fora desses filhos. 
É comerciante há mais de 6 anos e adquiriu a experiencia dos seus pais.
 Este e’ seu 1 financiamento na Hluvuku e com o presente financiamento de 13.000,00 irá comprar arroz, farinha, açúcar, óleo, feijão e caldo no sentido de aumentar o volume de mercadoria.
