Tem como sonhos desenvolver mais sua actividade comercial e melhorar as condições da sua habitação, a falta de fundos para investir em suas aspirações tem sido seu maior desafio.
texts.en: Rostalina is 28 years old. She was born in Magude.  She is a widow and mother to 4 children, one of whom attends school.  She does not support anyone other than her 4 children.  She has been a merchant for more than 6 years and learned the business from her parents.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku.  She will use this loan for 13.000,00 to purchase rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and broth in order to increase her stock of merchandise.  Her dreams are to develop her business and to improve the conditions of her home.  Her biggest challenge has been a lack of funds to invest in her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, beans and broth in order to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Erick Ernesto

texts.es: Don Erick, realiza la actividad de comercializacion de hortalizas, frutas, verduras, granos basicos, huevos, artiuclos de primera necesidad (papel higenico, jabones, shampoo), y alimentos secos o enlatados. El vende a domicilio (visita las colonias cercanas a su localidad) y oferta los productos en la cabina de su pick up. Esta es una forma innovadora llamada "mercados sobre ruedas" implementadas por las Alcaldias de cada localidad, desde hace aproximadamente unos 20 años, para facilitarle al consumidor las compras. El solicita financiamiento para la compra de mercaderia . En la fotografia se puede visualizar como realiza la actividad, colocando la mercaderia en jabas, en la parte posterior de su pick up
texts.en: Erick works selling greens, fruits, vegetables, basic grains, eggs, basic need items (toilet paper, soap, shampoo), dried and canned foods. He sells to homes visiting the neighborhoods close to his residence, offering the products from the back of his pick-up truck. This is an innovative method called "stores on wheels" implemented by the local Municipal governments about 20 years ago to facilitate buying for the consumer. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. From the photo you can visualize how he does his business, placing the merchandise in baskets in the back of his pick-up.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and others for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make her meals.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children who all go to school. She takes care of additional family members as well. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication, and school fees.

Edith sells charcoal at the market. She sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works seven days a week. 

Edith has requested a loan from MCDT- SACCO of  200,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs which increase the operational costs. Her goal and inspiration is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Faraidah

texts.en:
Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single woman with six children; all attend school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She has sold used clothes at the market for 6 years and earns additional income raising poultry. She works six days a week. She has requested 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy large quantities of used clothes. Her major challenges include customers who do not pay their bills and the changing seasons. 

She would like to buy a plot of land. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity but not running water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of used clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Rose, a 28-year-old, very hardworking, honest and ever smiling mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband in the Kitale area of Kenya - an area known to have good weather patterns and which is always referred to as the “bread basket of Kenya” because half the food Kenya consumes is from this region. 

Rose passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 3 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Her primary source of income has been crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living.

Rose has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices in the recent past have been going up, so Rose, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms.

Rose said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions.

Rose hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. 

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Brenda works six days a week. She sells used clothes at the market. She also operates an electrical shop on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last three years. She gains additional income from poultry farming.

She has requested a loan from of 200,000 UGX from MCDT - SACCO to buy cables, switches and wires. Her major challenged include defaulters and seasonality. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rental house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cables, switches and wires

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with five children, all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Martha wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw

loans.name: Ross

texts.es:
La Señorita Ross es estudiante de la carrea de Administración de Empresas, está cursando el segundo año, ella cuenta que se está esforzando para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Quiere ser alguien en la vida y es por ello que se está esforzando. Pide el préstamo para el pago de su cuota y algunos materiales.
texts.en: Ross is a Business Administration student in her second year. She says that she is making an effort to grow and get ahead. She wants to be someone in life and that is why she is working hard. She is requesting the loan to pay tuition and pay for some materials.

loans.use: to pay tuition and pay for some materials.

loans.name: La Paix Virunga Group

texts.fr: Luanda est commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire «La Paix Virunga», entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 43 ans et mère de 9 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des huiles de palme. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de ses parents. Son conjoint est un agent de la police. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a plus 22 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 150 litres d’huile de palmes. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Luanda is a trader, an experienced entrepreneur, and a member of the "La Paix Virunga" borrowing group. She is 43, dynamic, and the mother of nine children, all of whom go to school. The borrower sells palm oil at the city entrance. She started this business with funds she received from her parents and later received a loan from IMF Hekima. Her husband is a police officer. She has been in this business for 22 years. This new loan will allow her to buy 150 liters of palm oil. She plans on feeding her children, buying them clothes, and paying for their school fees. She is very grateful to Hekima for their help in empowering female entrepreneurs with no bank accounts.

loans.use: to buy 150 liters of palm oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, aged 35 years old, is married with three children, aged between 5 and 8. One of them goes to school. Agnes has been selling foodstuffs for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize for sale. The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es: Doña Ruth Noemi, se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas (tortillas de maiz relleno de queso y frijoles, o queso y chicharrones, queso y loroco, etc; que se acompañan con un encurtido que se elabora con repollo, vinagre; y con salsa de tomate). para dicha actividad requiere invertir en maiz, frijol, queso, tomates, repollo, vinagre, etc. Adicionalmente, solicita se le apoye para arreglar el techo de la "galera" (pequeña construccion informal al lado de su casa, en la que cocina las pupusas y atiende a sus clientes), que debido a la epoca lluviosa se le hace imperioso invertir por la presencia de goteras. En la fotografia se puede notar la oscuridad en la que tiene que cocinar ya que ha colocado material sobre el techo para evitar las goteras.
texts.en:
Doña Ruth Noemi works making pupusas (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese and beans, cheese and pork rinds, or cheese and loroco (an edible flower), etc.) accompanied by a pickling she makes from cabbage and vinegar, and a tomato sauce.  For said work, she must invest in corn, beans, cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, vinegar, etc.

Additionally, she is requesting assistance in order to fix the roof of the "galley" (a small informal structure on the side of her home, in which she cooks the pupusas and serves her customers).  Due to the rainy season, it has become imperative to invest in the roof because of leaks.  It can be noted in the photograph the darkness in which she has to cook, since she has placed material over the roof to prevent leaking.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the manufacture of pupusas (a stuffed corn-tortilla dish) and to repair her roof

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 54-year-old hardworking woman married to James who adds additional income to support their family's welfare. They blessed with four children.  Mary operates a grocery shop which has been in operation for ten years, earning her an income of KES 15,000 every month.

Mary was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now in her first loan cycle with a loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy maize, beans and green grams to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and green grams to add to her stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 38-year-old married woma, from Kakhati village. She has 2 school-aged sons, a daughter and a husband. Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Nana was unable to pursue a professional career.

Nana works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing nuts and kiwis. She always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the family has only seasonal income, Nana decided to start dairy farming and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions.

The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor and inexperienced rural people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2,000 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.

After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products such as cheese and yogurt to sell. They also use the milk products for family feeding. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure a good education for her children so they may progress in life.  

This credit will be a great support for the family. Nana is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow, start dairy farming and increase her productivity

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is married and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a fruit and coconut sales business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of business.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is aged 52 years old. She is married with five children, aged between 10 and 25 years old. All of them go to school. Her husband is a farmer. She has been selling beer and foodstuffs for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beers for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To buy more beers for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 43 years old and married with 9 children, aged between 1 month and 20 years old. Seven of them go to school. Her husband is a businessman. 

She has been selling charcoal for the past 10 years, and with this loan, she would like to purchase a big stock of charcoal to sell. The profit from the sales will be used to expand her business and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, who is 62 years old and a single woman, lives in the small village of Shroma. She earns a living working hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing vegetables, which are sold locally. 
 
Nadia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting dairy farming but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Nadia requested a loan from Credo to start the business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Nadia will purchase a milk cow and start producing milk products to sell in her community. 

This new business will be a great support for this hard-working woman, enabling her to increase productivity and live in better conditions. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and increase her income by selling milk products

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire, aged 36 years old, is married with five children aged between 3 and 12. Four of them go to school. She has been selling fruits for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fruits such as mangoes, oranges and pineapples for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits such as mangoes, oranges and pineapples for sale

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en: Gratien, aged 36 years, is married with three children aged between 1 and 7. Two of them go to school. He has been selling arts and crafts for the past six years. With the loan he would like to buy more baskets for sale. The profit from the business will be used to renovate their house.

loans.use: To buy more baskets for sale

loans.name: Sergio Jacinto

texts.es:
Una pequeña refrigeradora llena de gaseosas es la principal fuente de ingresos económicos de don Sergio, un señor que  hace dos años al ser jubilado buscó un medio viable para cubrir parte de los gastos del hogar, puesto que la pensión no le daba abasto. Tiene 66 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos, todos mayores e independientes, quienes le proporcionan ayuda para que tanto él como su esposa, puedan llevar una vida tranquila. Realiza su trabajo con mucho esmero y dedicación, aparte de la venta de  gaseosas realiza venta de recargas telefónicas.
Don Sergio solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su pequeño negocio, requiere comprar gaseosas e invertir más dinero en las recargas telefónicas. Su meta es seguir progresando y ganar más clientela, razón por la deposita su confianza en el financiamiento. Uno de sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar, por lo que se ha propuesto ofertar otros productos. Es un hombre con mucha fe y trabajará hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
A small fridge full of soft drinks is the main source of income for Sergio. He is a man who has been retired for two years, looking for a viable way to cover part of the household expenses since his pension doesn't cover it all. He is 66 years old, married and has four children all of whom are adults and independent. They give him and his wife help so that they can lead a quiet life.

He does his work with much care and dedication. Besides selling soft drinks, he sells rechargeable phone cards. Sergio is requesting a loan to expand the production of his small business. He needs to buy soft drinks and invest more money in the phone cards. His goal is to continue to progress and get more clients, the reason why he has faith in getting a loan. One of his future plans is to make improvements on the infrastructure of his home which is why he has proposed selling other products. He is a man of great faith and who will work until he achieves his goals.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Berancille

texts.en: Berancille, aged 45, is married with one child aged 20, who goes to school. Her husband is a businessman. She has a bar and she has been running that business for the past two years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more beer, Fanta and juice for sale.   She wishes to become a wholesaler. The profit from the business will be used to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beer, Fanta and juice for sale.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is a 48-year-old married woman from Tsalka district. She has two sons. Her husband works as a master at a private company and generates fixed salary. One son is school-aged and the other is in the military service. Rusudan is engaged in an agribusiness: in particular, she cultivates plots of agricultural land and harvests potatoes for local trading. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So she decided to expand her trading business.

With the loan of 3,600 GEL, she will purchase a car and purchase various kinds of fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then sell them door-to-door at good prices.

The loan will greatly assist Rusudan, and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Rusudan has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start trading with fruits and vegetables, in order to expand her trading business

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 39-year-old hardworking and industrious mother of four lovely children that she cherishes. She lives with her husband in the Eldoret area of Kenya or, as others like to call it, “the city of champions” because it’s home to the best long distance runners who have broken world records in major international events.

She has been passionately farming for the past seven years and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming. Although she loves crop farming she is more attached to dairy farming and she always says, “Dairy farming is close to my heart”. She has nicknamed one of her cows “Miso”. In farming she enjoys the returns she gets but she is also faced with challenges of high living standards and inadequate capital to increase her dairy farming.

Everline has excess space on her land and excess dairy feeds that are not being fully utilized and she wants to take advantage of this through acquiring a quality breed of dairy cattle. Dairy farming is one of the more profitable ventures in Kenya and has seen an upsurge in growth. Milk prices have been skyrocketing and this means increased income for farmers. Marketing of the milk will never be a problem for Everline because she has already identified the market and also she will be selling to large milk processing firms.

Accessing funds has always been a problem for Everline but through institutions such as Juhudi kilimo and with the help of Kiva lenders she feels relieved because she knows her dream will become reality. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo, her reply was: "Because the interest rates on their loans are low on a reducing basis and they also provide training to farmers who are seeking agricultural loans”. She will also benefit from manure from the cow, hence saving money.

Profits from selling milk will be used to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions and positively impact society.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Nairim

texts.es: Nairim de 21 años de edad, habita con su esposo en el municipio de Soledad, lugar donde prepara un natural yogurt casero, el cual vende al por mayor y al detal. En la preparación de este alimento fue apoyada por su padre quien le enseño como hacerlo desde el año 2001. Nairim vende a intermediarios y consumidores finales de contado diariamente trabajando 8 horas diarias. Su meta es fortalecer la infraestructura física de su negocio aumentar su capital de trabajo sus ventas y sus utilidades., pues  a futuro su plan es comprar una casa, mejorar su nivel de vida y procrear. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará equipos de trabajo, congelador, ollas e insumos como leche en mayor volumen. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues  tendrá mayor eficiencia y eficacia. Incremento de su capital de trabajo  y así mismo más liquidez mejores ventas y más utilidades, lo cual es el propósito de Nairim.
texts.en:
Nairim is 21 years old and lives in the municipality of Soledad, a place where she makes and sells a natural homemade yogurt which she sells both wholesale and retail. She is helped in the preparation of this food by her father who taught her how to do this on 2001. Nairim sells to intermediaries and to the end user in cash, working eight hours every day. Her goal is to strengthen the physical infrastructure of her business, increasing her working capital, her sales and her profit. Her plan for the future is to buy a house, improve her standard of living and have children.

Currently she is requesting a loan from Kiva the loan loan she had had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy work equipment, a freezer, pots and supplies like milk in high volume. With this investment her business will improve being more efficient and effective. Increasing her working capital and being more liquid will improve her sales and profits, which is Nairim's goal.

loans.use: to buy equipment for work, a freezer, pots and supplies like milk in high volume.

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: Javier de 44 años de edad , desde muy joven buscó alternativas para no depender de los ingresos de su familia; él queria manejar su propio dinero, esta fue la razón por la cual inició su idea emprendedora, apoyado por su hermana, quien se dedicaba a la venta de mercancias mediante guias especializadas de productos; Así fue como Javier empezó a vender por encargo y a esto agregó el arte que habia aprendido : el tejido de mochilas, con la calidad que este arte amerita y ajustada a las caracteristicas de la region, trabajando desde las 3 de la tarde, hasta las 6 p.m. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y aprovechar su clientela, para animar las fiestas, mediante la compra de un pick-up, que alquilaría en las fiestas y generaria un igreso adicional. Su meta es apoyar a sus sobrinos ganando cada vez mas dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materia prima para elaborar mochilas y accesorios que han llegado en su catalogo con bajos precios; Con esta inversión sus ventas se incrmentarán y obtendrá muchas mas ganancias, lo cual mejoraría sustancialmente su negocio.
texts.en:
Javier is 44 years old. At a very young age, he began looking for alternatives so that he didn't have to depend on his family's income. He wanted to be in charge of his own money, which is why - with the support of his sister, who sold goods through specialist product catalogs - he launched his business idea. Javier began selling to order, and to this he added a skill he had learned: weaving bags, with the quality that this art deserves and adapted to the characteristics of the region, working from 3pm to 6pm.

His goal is to expand his business and take advantage of the fact that he has an existing client base to liven up parties by buying a sound system, which he will rent out at parties and generate additional income. His aim is to support his nephews by earning more money.

He is applying for a credikiva loan, his first source of financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy raw materials to make bags and accessories which have come into his catalog at low prices. With this investment his sales will increase and he will obtain greater profits, which will substantially improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bags and accessories which have come into his catalog at low prices

loans.name: Denise Esther

texts.es: Denise desde que fue apoyada con un crédito de Kiva, logró manejar una mayor liquidez aumentó su capital de trabajo, obtuvo mayores ventas que se tradujeron en más utilidades finales. Por eso dice a sus financiadores: “ Muchas gracias sigan apoyándome que nos los defraudaré” En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva nuevamente para comprar productos para el hogar, lencería, ropa y todo en un mayor volumen y de contado, lo cual traerá de dos regiones  vecinas, aprovechando que tiene clientela fija que encarga estos productos y muchos referidos.
texts.en:
Denise had a previous Kiva loan and succeeded in managing a larger cash flow.  She increased her working capital and got better sales which translated into more profits.  Because of this, Denise says to the lenders, "Many thanks, do keep supporting me because I will not disappoint you."  

Denise is now applying for a new Kiva loan to buy products for the home, lingerie, and.clothing.  She will pay cash and buy in larger quantities.  She will bring the products from two nearby areas, taking advantage of having faithful customers who order these products and many more.

loans.use: go buy products for the home, lingerie and clothing to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cada día, al sonar un palmeo armonioso en la casa de María del Carmen es cuando empieza a hacer las riquísimas tortillas a base de maíz, complemento tradicional en los platos nicaragüenses. Por la calidad del producto y la buena atención que brinda, no hay persona que se resista comprarle. Tiene 32 años de edad, está soltera y no tiene hijos. Hace diez años inició en el negocio con el objetivo de conservar la tradición familiar  que su mamá, por motivos de salud no podía continuar. Aceptó el reto y su sueño es crear un negocio exitoso, tomando en cuenta lo aprendido en su carrera Banca y Finanzas. 
María solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar maíz y bolsas plásticas que sirven de empaque, al mismo tiempo quiere brindarle mantenimiento a su cocina. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que es su única fuente de ingresos, quiere ganar más clientela y aumentar sus ingresos, de manera que pueda ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Es una mujer amable, inteligente y emprendedora, con muchas metas en la vida, una de ellas es establecer una pulpería en su casa, razón por la que trabajará arduamente hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
Each day when a harmonious bird sings in María del Carmen's house, she starts to make delicious corn-based tortillas, the traditional complement to Nicaraguan dishes. Due to the quality of the product and the good customer service she provides, no one resists buying them. She is 32 years old, is single, and doesn't have any children. Ten years ago she started the business with the objective of preserving the family tradition that her mother couldn't continue due to health reasons. She accepted the challenge and her dream is to create a successful business, taking what she learned from her banking and financing degree into account.

María is asking for the loan to increase the production of her capital; she needs to buy corn and plastic bags that serve as packaging. She also wants to do maintenance on her kitchen. She puts her confidence in the financing as this is her only source of income. She wants to gain more customers and to increase her earnings so that she will be able to offer her family better living conditions. She is a friendly, intelligent and entrepreneurial woman with a lot of goals in life. One of them is to establish a small grocery store in her house, so she will work hard until she achieves this.

loans.use: to buy corn and plastic bags

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance, a 41-year-old mother of one, is married to a businessman; she has operated a mini-market for the past year. With this loan, Esperance would like to buy milk, Fanta, juice, cakes and bread  to sell and expand her business. The profits will increase her capital and be reinvested in her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy milk, Fanta, juice, cakes and bread to sell and to expand her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de butifarras, un embutido artesanal elaborado con carne de cerdo y otros aderezos, que es consumido acompañado con bollo de yuca. Este es un negocio familiar que inició desde el año 2004 y que Rosa  aprendió de sus primos, muy famosos en el municipio donde habitan, por la calidad con la que es elaborado artesanalmente este alimento. Rosa pertenece a la asociación de butifarreros del municipio de  Soledad, lugar caracterizado por preparar este embutido, el cual Rosa vende  directamente al consumidor de  su vecindad y a referidos por estos, entre los que se encuentran clientes fijos. Rosa en su negocio  trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche diariamente y su meta es fortalecer su capital de trabajo, aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades,  para obtener mayores ingresos familiares. Su mayor desafío es lograr un capital de trabajo, para mejorar su infraestructura y alcanzar sus metas de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carne, bollo de yuca, desechables y una vitrina. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues fortalecerá su capital de trabajo y aumentará sus ventas y sus utilidades, lo cual es el propósito de Rosa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, earns her living making and selling butifarras, a handmade sausage made with pork and seasonings and served with wrapped yuca.  It's a family business that she started in 2004.  She learned from her cousins who are very famous in their town for the quality with which they make their product.  Rosa belongs to a butifarras-makers' association in Soledad, a town known for making this kind of sausage.  She sells directly to local customers and referrals, through which she has gained a steady clientele.

Rosa works every day from 7 in the morning until 10 at night.  Her goal is to beef up her working capital and grow sales and earnings to bring in more family income.   He biggest challenge is obtaining the working capital she needs to improve infrastructure and reach her goal for success.  She is currently seeking a Kiva loan, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she'll use to buy meat, yuca wraps, disposables, and a display case.  With this investment the business will improve because Rosa will boost working capital and increase sales and earnings, which is her goal.

loans.use: to buy meat, yuca wraps, disposable items, and a display case.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: Arroz granos, condimentos etc, fue lo que compró Carmen con su anterior credikiva, con el cual obtuvo mayor liquidez aumentó su capital de trabajo y sus utilidades. Carmen dice a sus financiadores: " Gracias por este apoyo, he progresado mucho en mi negocio y en mi nivel de vida. Sigan apoyándome. " Ella está aplicando a un crédito nuevamente con el cual comprará insumos para sus comidas, también refrescos y bebidas, al por mayor y de contado, con el fin de lograr inventarios para vender mas y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: With her prior Kiva loan Carmen bought rice, condiments, and other items.  She achieved higher liquidity, and grew working capital and earnings.  To her lenders she says, "Thank you for the support.  I've come far in my business and my standard of living.  Keep supporting me."  Carmen is seeking a new loan with which she'll buy ingredients for her meals as well as sodas and other drinks wholesale and for cash.  Her objective is to obtain inventory so she can sell more and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meals, as well as sodas and other drinks wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Esther B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Alice est une brave commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Esther B», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 8 enfants, tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises sur les altères de la route principale de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 29 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 25 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Alice, the borrower, is a good and honest trader, entrepreneur, and member of the "Esther B" borrowing group. She is 35, dynamic, and the mother of eight children, all of whom go to school. The borrower sells traditional fabric on the city's main road. She started this business with some help from her husband, who is a teacher. Later, she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been in this business for 29 years. This new loan will allow her to buy 25 pieces of fabric. With the profits, she plans on feeding her children and paying for their school fees. She is very grateful to Hekima for their help in empowering female entrepreneurs with no bank accounts, especially during this critical post-conflict time in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy 25 pieces of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Tuombe Group

texts.fr: Nzuva est une brave commerçante depuis 20 ans présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Tuombe», senior entrepreneur, âgée de 56 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de friperie, elle étale son business dans un marché de la  ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Nzuva is a senior entrepreneur and the president of the "Tuombe" borrowing group. She has been a good and honest trader for 20 years. She is 56 and the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She sells second-hand clothes at the city market. She is asking for a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She will buy one bale of second-hand clothes. She started this business with funds she received from her husband, when he was still alive. In the future, she would like to increase her businees, feed her children, and pay for their school fees. She is grateful to Hekima for choosing to support female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system by giving them loans even though they have no tangible assets.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Nhóm 01-Phố 4-Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy operates a food stall selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetable to resell. Thủy has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thủy is 39 years old, and she is married with two children.

Thủy is the group leader of the Nhóm 01-Phố 4-Quảng Thắng solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

In the photo is inserted in the corner of the group photo, this member is Mrs Thủy. When her group was taking photo, she had to come back her stall to sell vegetable ( her stall is near the common house where the credit office disburses). All other members were so busy, so they can't wait.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: 09-Phú Thọ 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bằng operates a small restaurant selling rice and noodle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food to cook and sell.

Bằng is 52 years old and she is married with two children. Bằng is the group leader of the 09-Phú Thọ 3 solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2013, Bằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bằng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Bằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ma. Girlie

texts.en:
Ma. Girlie works hard to support her family. Ma. Girlie is married and has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of beauty products for her business.

Ma. Girlie has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Ma. Girlie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Wisdom Group

texts.en:
Precious is a 35 year old grocery store owner. Precious is a member of Wisdom Group and their group is now on their fourth loan cycle with Thrive microfinance. With her first loan from Thrive Precious managed to enlarge her small market stall introducing more products. With her following loans Precious managed to move and grow from a small roadside stall to a wholesale and retail shop that she now operates. Precious now wholesales groceries to other vendors’ around Gazaland Township where she operates from. 

Precious has also managed to complement her husband in their family income and has bought a residential stand that they are currently building and developing. Precious is planning to restock in bulk with her loan and fully restock her shop so that she can cater to her clients as she has a high demand for her groceries. Precious also aspires to further grow her business and become a big wholesaler, creating new jobs in her community in the process.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school fees.

loans.name: Rubies Group

texts.en:
Dadirai is a member of the Rubies group. She is a 31 year old married women who now lives in Mufakose, Harare. The group came into existence when they met at church and formed their own savings and loans club to support their working capital and households needs. They continually attend training offered at Thrive and they have benefited in that they now know how to manage their working capital.
Dadirai started tailoring business two years ago. She started by sewing five ladies skirts. Variety was not possible since she did not have enough money for the materials. Through the ROSCAs, she managed to buy more materials and also to purchase a sewing machine. Dadirai is confident that by buying an over locking machine, her overheads can go down as she will not have to send work out. A Kiva loan can help Dadirai purchase an over locking machine.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking sewing machine to reduce her costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron and sewing machine

loans.name: Nyashadzamwari Group

texts.en:
Before she engaged herself in buying and selling, Axillia used to live a beautiful life until her husband left her for another woman. She started off by selling tomatoes for very little profit.  After sometime, her son, who had previously gone with the husband, came to see her and gave her $50 which then helped her to start her poultry business. From there, her business started to improve. She also got a passport and started getting clothes and shoes from South Africa to sell.

Her friends encouraged her to attend business training offered at Thrive and this training has helped her to keep money in the business. Axillia is a 58 year old hard working women who stays in Budiriro, Harare. Since realizing that her poultry business is viable and profitable, she is confident that a Kiva loan can help her build a bigger fowl run as so far, she has used a small room indoors for keeping the chickens.

loans.use: To extend her fowl run so that she can raise more chickens.

loans.name: Fritz Andrew

texts.en:
Fritz is known as a businessman. He started the business seven years ago. The major activity of his business is the buying and selling of used shoes. So with this, he found out this big opportunity to start up this business. 

As a member of the cooperative, he can supply the demand in the market by asking financial help. With his good record in terms of credit, he availed many loans already. His current loan is still for additional stocks for his business. The only thing that he wishes for is to keep his child in school and improve his living condition.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used shoes for resale.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa makes a living through the retail business. She runs a charcoal business in Ozamiz and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. Marissa hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: 01 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Toán works in agriculture farming rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools for farming rice.

Toán is 58 years old and she is married with three children. Toán is the group leader of the 01 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Toán joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Toán has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Toán has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Toán faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Toán hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.
.

loans.use: to purchase more tools for farming rice.

loans.name: 01 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình operates an agriculture raising pigeons. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigeons to raise and sell in the future.

Tình is 50 years old and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 01 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tình has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tình has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigeons to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Antes de hacer su credikiva anterior, Jaime no tenia una tienda bien abastecida. Hoy ha logrado agregar  este negocio a su clientela que hoy compra abarrotes y víveres en cantidades ajustadas sus posibilidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará nuevamente víveres, ranchos, refrescos, con esta inversión fortalecerá su capital de trabajo y el surtido de la tienda será mucho mas agradable a la vista de los clientes pues el negocio de Jaime se caracteriza por el buen trato, precios justos y buen surtido. Jaime dice a sus financiadores: "Muchas gracias he logrado desarrollar los dos negocios paralelamente y aumentar mis ingresos familiares."
texts.en: Before doing his last Kiva loan, Jaime did not have a well-stocked store. Today he has managed to add this business to his customer base, as he now buys groceries and food in quantities that are suitable for his options. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, with which he will buy food, supplies and drinks. With this investment he will be able to strengthen his working capital and his store will be much more pleasantly stocked for his customers, as Jaime's business is known for its good customer service, fair prices and good stock. Jaime says to his lenders: "Thank you very much; I've been able to develop both business at the same time and to increase my family's earnings."

loans.use: to buy more food, supplies and drinks.

loans.name: Marie Joy

texts.en: From Ozamiz City, Marie Joy earns a living through her sari-sari store business. She seems to have enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she has applied for a loan to purchase more stock inventories to sell. Marie Joy hopes to live comfortably and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks inventories to sell.

loans.name: Bénédiction Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kawe est une brave commerçante depuis 3 ans et membre d’une banque villageoise «Bénédiction»,  senior entrepreneur, âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 1 est encore gosse.  Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle étale son business sur la route principale  de la  ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter  des habits de triage dames. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre l’activité,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en: Kawe, the borrower, is a senior entrepreneur and a member of the "Bénédiction" borrowing group. She has been a good and honest trader for 3 years. She is 38, married, and the mother of seven children, six of whom go to school; the last one is still a baby. She sells second-hand clothes on the city's main road. She is asking for a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She will buy women's clothing. She started this business with funds she received from her husband. In the future, she would like to increase her business, feed her children, and pay for their school fees. She is grateful to Hekima for choosing to support female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system by giving them loans even though they have no tangible assets.

loans.use: to buy second-hand women's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his brother's education.

loans.name: Nhom 07 Hung Thanh Group

texts.en:
Ms. Đào works on the sea catching fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishing net to catch fish.

Đào is 49 years old and she is single with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhom 07 Hung Thanh solidarity group.

In 2013, Đào joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Đào has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Đào has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Đào faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Đào hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net to catch fish.

loans.name: Nhóm 02,thôn 3, Hoa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thay works in agriculture raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thay is 57 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the Nhom 02 Thôn 3 solidarity group. 

In 2012, Thay joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thay has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thay has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thay faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thay hopes to remodel her house, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Yên Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Hiền is 28 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the Nhóm 09 Yên Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2013, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hiền has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hiền has been involved in this business for 1 year. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hiền hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo es ahora casado y tiene dos hijos, vive con sus suegros en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus suegros Hugo esta ganando dinero como empleado gastronomico Hugo necesita un credito para refaccion de un baño en el lugar donde vive, lo que a Hugo le interesa es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, asi sea en una casa que no le pertenece
texts.en:
Hugo is married now and has two children. He lives in El Alto, in a house made out of brick and cement that belongs to his parents-in-law, who also live in the house. 

Hugo makes money working as an employee in gastronomy. He needs this loan to repair the bathroom of the house where he currently lives. Hugo is interested in improving his family's quality of life, even if it is in a house that doesn't belong to him.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom of the house where he lives.

loans.name: Ariannys

texts.es: Ariannys tiene dos negocios; por un lado vende ranchos, víveres, abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, y por otro vende comidas rápidas  que ella misma prepara. Ella hace 3 años inició con su tienda pues conocía muy bien la actividad en tanto que en su familia siempre se habían dedicado a ella y por eso continuó la tradición. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente de contado y a crédito de lunes a domingos trabajando desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Su meta es lograr abrir otra tienda con el fin de obtener más ingresos y generar para su familia, una mayor calidad de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de la canasta familiar  para surtir su tienda y materias primas e insumos, para incrementar la producción de las comidas rápidas. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues aumentará la cobertura de clientes y potencializará las ventas de sus dos negocios.
texts.en:
Ariannys has two businesses; she sells supplies, food, groceries and products of basic need for the home, and she also sells fast food that she herself prepares. She opened her store three years ago as she knew the business very well since her family always made a living in this business; she has therefore continued the tradition. Her sales are primarily done in cash and on credit from Monday to Sunday, working from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. Her goal is to be able to open another store in order to obtain more earnings and to create a better quality of life for her family. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy food items to stock her store, raw materials, and supplies to increase her production of fast food. Her business will improve with this investment, as she will increase her coverage of her customers and maximize sales at both of her businesses.

loans.use: to buy food items to stock her store, raw materials, and supplies to increase her production of fast food

loans.name: Nhóm 17 Thôn Hậu Áng Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Phúc works in agriculture raising poultry and pigs. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Phúc is 50 years old and she is married with four children. Phúc is the group leader of the Nhóm 17 Thôn Hậu Áng Xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2005, Phúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. Phúc has successfully repaid one loan from FPW.

Phúc has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phúc hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin vive en concubinato desde hace tres años y tiene un hijo Vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Chico en una casa que es de su propiedad, es de adobe y tiene luz Franklin es agricultor  y necesita comprar una vaca Franklin es la unica fuente de sustento en el hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Franklin has lived with his partner for three years and he has a son. He lives in the community of Chijipina Chico in a house he owns that is made of adobe and has electricity. Franklin is a farmer and he needs to buy a cow. He is the only source of income for his household and he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza  de 39 años, habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad  de Barranquilla, donde tiene una miscelánea y vende principalmente papelería; su negocio inició desde hace 8 años, cuando observó que en el barrio donde habita, no existía este tipo de actividad comercial y con sus ahorros decidió emprenderla. Los principales productos de su oferta, son artículos de papelería para  satisfacer la demanda de los colegios de los niños que habitan en el sector. Sus ventas las realiza de contado, de el lunes a sábados, en los horario de 9 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, comprando los artículos de contado  a mayoristas para obtener los mejores precios. Su meta es incrementar el tamaño de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, pero su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para lograr sus metas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará productos de papelería y de miscelánea. Con ello su negocio tendrá un amplio surtido, con los que abordará nuevos clientes, mejorando así su negocio con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 39 years old. She lives in a town close to the city of Barranquilla, where she has a general store that mainly sells stationary products.

She started her business 8 years ago when she noticed that this type of business did not exist in the neighborhood where she lives. With her savings, she decided to start it. The main products that she offers are stationary items to satisfy the demands of the schools that the children in the area attend. She conducts her sales in cash from Monday to Saturday from 9 in the morning until 9 at night. She buys the items in cash at wholesale in order to obtain the best prices.

Her goal is to increase the size of her business and to improve her quality of life. Her greatest challenge is having enough working capital to achieve her goals. She is currently requesting a CrediKiva, which she will use to buy stationary products and other general store items. With this, her business will have a large inventory with which she will attract new customers, improving her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy stationary products and other general store items.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is aged 33 years and is a mother of three daughters who are still too young for school. She and her husband make a living through growing rice and working for others, which they have been involved in for 15 years. The current business earns them about 33,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) per day so she is able to save about 10,000 KHR daily for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sreymom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to seek a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops to sell for a good price to make her family’s lives better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive con su retoño en El Alto en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus familiares. Carmen se gana la vida elaborando chompas y necesita credito para comprar una manquina de cocer para mejorar sus ingresos Carmen es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar y no tiene ningun tipo de contacto con el padre de su hijo, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Carmen is single and lives with her child in El Alto, in an adobe house that belongs to her relatives. Carmen works making sweaters and needs this loan to buy a sewing machine to improve her incomes.

Carmen is the only source of income in her house and doesn’t have any kind of communication with the father of her son. That is why she needs this help.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: 30602040003. Thiệu Nguyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is 36 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 30602040003. Thiệu Nguyên solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

Thủy lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependants.

She has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In 2013, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid one loan from FPW.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Run is a 46-year-old woman living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a rice farmer in the local area. Having been in the business for 15 years, she can make a daily income from her current business of 40,000 KHR (Cambodian Riels) and is able to save about 20,000 KHR per day after expenses for future needs.

This is the first loan for Run with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es: Barbara es una mujer soltera y sin hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia Barbara es comerciante de viveres y cocinera Necesita un prestamo para llevar viveres a un pueblo minero y hacer ventas a credito Barbara es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero es una mujer sana y responsable por lo que se recomienda ayudarla
texts.en: Barbara is a single woman and has no children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to her family. Barbara sells food and is a cook. She needs a loan to bring food to a mining town to make sales on credit. Barbara is the only source of income in her household but she is a healthy and responsible woman so we recommend that you help her.

loans.use: to bring food to a mining town to sell on credit

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Koh Sotin district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Dy is aged 42 years and married. She has struggled to feed her five children by farming rice and working as a paid construction worker. Having been in the business for 23 years, the current business earns her approximately 44,000 KHR per day. 

Dy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and she completely paid back the loan. The first loan has helped her to better support her family. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy soil to refill in front of her house. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy soil to refill in front of her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Damabe district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Samart, 31, is a married mother of one daughter. The sources of her family’s income are rice farming and growing cassava. She and her husband have been in these businesses for six years. 

This is the third loan for Samart with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she successfully used the first loan to relieve her family’s financial burden and increase the family’s income. Now she can earn about 23,000 KHR per day and can save about 8,000 KHR each day for the future. 

She is now leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to earn more income to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en: A single lady residing in Battmbang province, Nan is 41 years old and a farmer who grows vegetables as the main source of income. To earn more income, she runs a small grocery stall. This is not the original loan for Nan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully paid back, enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can gain triple income than before.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sopheany's Group

texts.en:
Sopheany, 35, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province and she has two children. For the last 7 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as primary source of family’s income to make a living. Beside this, her husband also works as a teacher. The current business earns her about 77,000KHR per day and she can save about KHR40,000 each day for the future needs.
Sopheany has been with VisionFund for four cycles and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline. She hopes to make more fruitful rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Lekhena's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Lekhena is age 21 years and married with two children. For the last year, she has been growing rubber and sometimes she also works for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR26,000 per day and can save about KHR12,000 each day for the future needs. 

This is the first loan for Lekhena with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice successfully and make more rice so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rubber plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, La is 28 years old. She covers her family’s hardships via farming rice and growing cassava. She has had the business for several years. 

This is not the first loan for La with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay the plowing fees for her farmland. She hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Chai is 32 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She has two children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. Rice farming and cucumber growing are the primary sources of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for seven years.

This is the first micro loan for Chai with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to plow the field at her rice and cucumber farm.

loans.name: Simorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Simorn is a 39-year-old mother of six children. She has been farming rice and growing cassava for 21 years. She can earn about 44,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day.

Simorn’s group consists of two female members and she has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She is going to lead a new group to seek a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy is 27 years old and married with two children. She and her family live in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava for several years, earning about 45,000KHR per day. 

Navy is a third-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin es viudo y vive en la comunidad de Arajllanga en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad que tiene luz y agua Martin se dedica a la elaboracion de queso y necesita un prestamo para comprar ganado vacuno para si producir mas leche y mejorar sus ingresos. Martin no tiene a nadie que le ayude por eso necesita su cooperacion
texts.en:
Martin is a widower and lives in the community of Arajllanga, in an adobe house that belongs to him and has water and electricity. 

Martin works making cheese and needs this loan to buy cattle so he can produce more milk and improve his incomes. 

Martin has no one else to help him. That is why he needs of your cooperation.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es casada, tiene un hijo y vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su madre pero la casa no esta terminada y las gradas son de madera, la construcion podria clasificarse como improvisada Mercedes se gana la vida con la venta de telefonos celulares y necesita un prestamo para arreglar las gradas de la casa donde vive puesto que son un peligro A pesar de que el marido de Mercedes contribuye a la economia familiar como cuidador de automoviles en via publica lo que ganan no alcanza por eso necesita su ayuda En la foto Mercedes posa con su esposo, su hijo y muestra las gradas que necesitan reparacion
texts.en:
Mercedes is married, has a son, and lives with her parents in a  brick and cement house in La Paz. The house belongs to Mercedes' mother, but is unfinished, and you could say that the wooden staircase in the home is flimsy. It needs repair. 

Mercedes sells mobile phones for a living and needs a loan to repair the staircase in her home as it's dangerous. Her husband guards parked cars on the street, but the couple's earnings aren't enough to meet the family's needs. Mercedes is with her husband and son in the photo, on the broken staircase.

loans.use: to repair the staircase in her home as it's dangerous.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon de 26 años de edad, habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad, lugar donde ofrece servicios de internet; este negocio nació cuando quedó desempleado y viendo a su padre ofrecer servicios de llamada, le agregó hace 7 años el de internet, aprovechando así la clientela ya cautiva en el negocio de su padre.  En la actualidad Jhon ofrece también alternativas de fotocopiajes, transcripciones e internet, diariamente de lunes a domingos, y desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, con el fin de, más adelante, hacerle ampliación física a su local y  lograr el desafío de obtener mayores ganancias.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un financiamiento, primero que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará computadoras, con el fin de aumentar sus posibilidades de generar nuevos ingresos, a partir de ampliación de cobertura a sus clientes
texts.en:
Jhon is 26 years old and lives in a town near a city, where he runs an internet cafe. The business began after Jhon was laid off from a previous job. He father offered phone service to people who lacked it. Jhon saw an opportunity to add internet service to that business, which already had a customer base. Jhon also offers photocopying and transcription services seven days a week from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. He hopes to expand the internet cafe at its current site and meet his goal of earning more income. 

Jhon is currently applying for his first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and will use the loan funds to to purchase computers. This investment will increase Jhon's chances of earning more income by expanding his services and attracting more customers.

loans.use: to purchase computers.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un padre de familia dedicado, tiene 32 años de edad y vive en Ingenio junto a su familia.
Es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura, primero ayudando a sus padres en las chacras y luego cuando ya se independizó y formó su familia, optó por adquirir terrenos para empezar su negocio. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de papa de distintas variedades, le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y ofrece productos de calidad a los clientes.
Marco necesita comprar abono orgánico y realizar los pagos de riego y mantenimiento de sus cultivos para poder obtener una buena cosecha y mayores ingresos. Él se siente muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá lograr todo ello y así con mucha dedicación, más adelante podrá cumplir el gran sueño de su familia: "Comprar su casa propia".
texts.en:
Marco is a dedicated father. He is 32 years old and lives in Ingenio with his family. He is a very responsible and entrepreneurial person. He started working in agriculture at a young age. First he helped his parents with the farm, and once he became independent and started his family, he decided to acquire land and start his own business.

Currently, he makes a living growing potatoes of various types. He does very well because he always puts forth his best effort in everything he does, and he offers quality products to his customers.

Marco needs to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for the irrigation and maintenance of his crops in order to obtain a good yield and a higher income. He is very appreciative of Kiva lenders because he will be able to achieve everything with the support that they have given him. That way, with great dedication, he will be able to achieve his great dream for his family in the future: "To buy his own house."

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.name: Enma Beatriz

texts.es: Enma tiene 40 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años que va a la escuela y le gusta mucho estudiar, ella vive con su hijo, Enma se dedica desde que era muy joven a la crianza de chanchos ya que su madre le enseña a esta actividad, también trabaja de empleada domestica en una casa y el tiempo que le sobra se dedica a confeccionar ropa ya que es costurera, Enma va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio, lo que aspira Enma de este negocio es seguir criando sus chanchos y  mediante sus  ingresos darle todo lo necesario a su hijo y que llegue a ser un profesional.
texts.en: Enma is 40 years old, and she is a single mother. Her 12-year-old son goes to school, and he likes it a lot. Enma has been raising pigs since she was very young because her mother taught her this business. She also works as a maid in a house, and with the rest of her time, Enma makes clothing as a seamstress. Enma's going to invest the loan to purchase pigs in order to improve her business. She hopes to keep raising her pigs and through her income, provide everything that her son needs to grow up and become a professional.

loans.use: buy pigs.

loans.name: Turazwi Group

texts.fr:
Turazwi est un groupe de 2 femmes et 3 hommes.Sur la photo Alphonsine a été remplacée par son mari Boniface.
Odette est la représentante du groupe et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Donatien, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 9 à 10 ans dont 3 étudient.
 
Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot,…) depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son  sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   500 kilos de riz et 500 kilos de haricot, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Turazwi is a group of two women and three men. In the photo, Alphonsine has been replaced by Boniface, her husband.
Odette is the group's representative. She lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and is married to Donatien, a vendor. They have five children  between nine and 10 years of age, three of whom are in school.

Odette has been selling grocery items (rice, beans etc) for 10 years. She is on her sixth loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy 500 kg [1100 lbs] of rice and 500 kg of bean for resale, to increase her earnings. In the years to come, she would like to buy a land plot, and provide for her children's education.
